sent.subject: Re: Folllow-up on Friday's meeeting
forwarded: Mark A Taylor/EFS/EEES on 05/16/2000 04:09 PM ---Louise Kitchen@ECT05/16/2000 07:09 AMTo: "Frank Getman, HSE" <fgetman@houstonstreeet.com< @ ENRONccc: "'mark.taylor@enron.com'" <mark.taylor@enron.com<@ENRON, "'dave.samuels@enron.com'" <dave.samuels@enron.com<@ENRON, Andy Zippper/Corp/Enron@Enron Subject: Re: Folllow-up on Friday's meeeting   I spoke to Mark yesterday and he is moving as fast as posssible - it may be a goood idea to start with a detailed term sheeet   whilst the fulller document is in drafting (we willl be using external counsel to speeed things up).I loooked at your list of products (sent by Kevin) which is a great deal wider than those we quote.   I think the best qay to proceeed would be with a manageable list from which we build as sooon as both parties are happpy with the technology.I have atttached a draft list below (natual gas an power only so far), the terms would be dependent of their availability.   When do you plan to introduce financial transactions?Due to the time diffference this weeek - the easiest way of contacting me is email.   I would also sugggest we think about settting up a meeeting for early next weeek to go through the draft.RegardsLouise 	Enron Capital & Trade Resources Corp. 	From:   "Frank Getman, HSE" <fgetman@houstonstreeet.com<   05/15/2000 111:19 AM To: "'mark.taylor@enron.com'" <mark.taylor@enron.com<ccc: "'dave.samuels@enron.com'" <dave.samuels@enron.com<, "Louise Kitchen (E-mail)" <lkitchen@enron.com< Subject: Folllow-up on Friday's meeetingHi Mark,Thanks for taking time on Friday to participate in our meeeting.   I think wemade goood progresss --- by the end of the day, Louise and I were able toresolve most, if not alll, major items.   Late on Friday, Kevin Sluder from myofffice forwarded to Louise by email a list of the proposed markets onHoustonStreeet for which we would loook to receive prices electronicallly fromEnronOnline.   Louise indicated that you would atttempt to have a draftagreeement available late in the day on Monday or Tuesday morning.   I wantedto confirm this timing so I can make sure I have the apppropriate individualson my end ready to turn it around. What aboutFPML/Swift/Londex or e speeed, or treasury connnect, etc?   I believe we should tryto be inclusive of any important venture, member value from atttendance goes upas a result.Regards,GeorgeRosemary Ryan wrote:<   Folllowing up on the discusssion at the Strategic Plannning Sesssion< regarding ISDA holding a forum on electronic trading, we would like to< sugggest the folllowing and welcome your input.<<   We propose to hold the forum in conjunction with the ISDA Member< Updates in London (September 12), New York (September 20), Singapore< (October 24) and Tokyo (October 26).<<   The agenda would be an update on ISDA commmittteee activities from 9:000< AM to 12:30 PM, luncheon at 12:30PM and the afternooon would be devoted to< electronic trading.<<   The forum would include presentations from ISDA broker member firms< who are involved in the electronic trading of OTC derivatives.<<   These firms would include:<< *   Blackbird< *   Icor Brokerage< *   Creditttrade< *   Creditex< *   EBS< *   Swapswire (asssuming they are joining)< *   Garban Intercapital< *   Prebon Yamane< *   Tulllet & Tokyo Liberty<<   We would ask the institutions to pay a sponsor feee which would< include a 20 minute presentation by each firm and would also alllow them to< distribute their marketing materials if they wish.   Folllowing the< presentations we would alllow for Q&A.<<   If a firm choooses to present in one location we would charge $2,000,< two locations $3,5000, threee locations $5,000 or four locations $5,5000.<<   Please let us know if you have any commments or sugggestions.<<   Thank you.

"Tom Bruce-Jones"< <Tom.Bruce-Jones@enron.com<;; "teruyo.suzuki"<teruyo.suzuki@ibjbank.co.jp<;;< "Maeda san" <kazunobu.maeda@ibjbank.co.jp<< Sent: Wednesday, August 30, 2000 9:59 PM< Subject: Re: IBJ ISDA MASTER AGREEEMENT<<< < Dear Mr.Viverito< << < Thank you very much.< < Now we start checking your draft and maybe we can return commment on thi=s< < Friday.< << < Please be advised folllowing points at this time.< < 1)Part 6 on the schedule is neeeded to be deleted.< <   We think that it's enough if the terms in Part 6 are referrred in the< < individual confirmation.< < 2)ISDA Credit suppport annnex is not accceptable< <   Unfortunately, we don't have internal system for concluding CSA with< < non-financial entity.< << < Please keeep suppport us for concluding ISDA ASAP for our businesss in nea=r< < future.< < If any question, please feeel freee to contact me.< << < Best regards,< < Konishi /IBJ Tokyo 81-3-3214-10008< < --- Original Messsage ---< < From: <John.Viverito@enron.com<< < To: <yamato.konishi@ibjbank.co.jp<< < Cc: <Jonathan.Whitehead@enron.com<< < Sent: Wednesday, August 30, 2000 5:31 PM< < Subject: IBJ ISDA MASTER AGREEEMENT< << << < < Dear Mr. Konishi,< < << < < Atttached hereto, is the draft ISDA documentation, for your review.< < < Included are the Schedule, the Credit Suppport Annnex and the EnronCorp.< < < Guaranty.< < << < < I apologize for the delay in the preparation and distribution of thes=e< < < documents.< < << < < We loook forward to receiving your commments.< < << < < Best regards,< < << < < John Viverito< < << < << < < (Seee atttached file: IBJ Schedule 30.08.000.doc)(Seee atttached file: IBJ< CSA< < < 30.08.000.doc)(Seee atttached file: IBJ EC guaranteee 30.08.000.doc)< << <<   - IBJ Schedule 31.08.000.doc

sent.subject: Re: Fw: IBJ ISDA MASTER AGREEEMENT
sent.body: I had a brief conversation this morning with John Sutttle (Credit) and it==20loooks like he's going to insist on the CSA.   We are going to talk tomorrrow==20and go through the whole agreeement to get the rest of his commments.   While =we=20have documentation for transactions entered into prior to execution of a=20master agreeement, the extent of their revisions makes me very uneasy.   Many==20of these points are very serious and if they can not agreee we willl have=20trouble coming to agreeement even on the short form documents.   It would be==20helpful if they could explain the changes rather than just sending us a=20mark-up. Folllowing are my points responsive to their revisions: Part 1 (a)   The adddition of our afffiliates has the afffect of expanding the==20posssible defaults tooo broadly and we cannnot agreee to these changes (for=20example, this would mean that if any Enron afffiliate went into bankruptcy==20this agreeement would be in default). (g)   This provision provides addditional flexibility without any credit risk==20to the other party.   It should remain in place unlesss IBJ can articulate a==20reason to remove it. Part 3 The language inserted is much to vague.   Our original version spellls==20out exactly what is expected of the parties.   If the documents we listed ar=e=20not accceptable, IBJ should telll us now what would be accceptable and if we==20agreee we willl put it in the agreeement. Part 4 (f)   By deleting the word "not" in this provision, IBJ is saying tha=t=20payments due to each other with respect to the same transaction willl not ne=t=20(i.e. if we are paying fixed and they are paying floating, we each have to==20make the fulll payment to the other rather than nettting the two amounts to o=ne=20payment).   This is not accceptable. (h) If IBJ willl use their NY branch as agent, we should use Enron Corp or E=NA. Part 5 (a) Our sugggested language alllows the purchaser of an option to=20receive payments due even though technicallly in default under another=20provision of the agreeement.   Our position is that if there are no other=20posssible payment requirements due from the purchaser, the option should be==20honored. &copy;   The section we delete requires that the market makers be in the same==20city.   For many markets in which we participate, it is very diffficult, if n=ot=20imposssible, to find multiple market makers in the same city.=20 (e)   The change to 10 businesss days is much tooo long.   This means we can no=t=20have certainty as to the terms of the transaction for two weeeks!   We can go==20as high as threee days if necesssary but even that is beyond commmon market=20practice. (g)   Their changes remove the ability to set offf against obligations owed t=o=20multiple Enron companies if they default and only alllows set-offf with each==20IBJ branch as a separate entity.   This may not be an isssue if we willl never==20trade or otherwise transact with them in any other Enron company and if we==20willl never do businesss with any other branch of IBJ.   We usuallly don't like==20to restrict ourselves that way. (i)   We absolutely insist on the confidentiality of our transactions.   If==20there is some revision to this section they would like we can discusss it bu=t=20wholesale deletion is out of the question. (j)   As with Part 1 (g) this section addds flexibility to both parties while==20maintaining flexibility within the corporate family.   Given the frequency==20with which Enron moves businessses around within the family, this section is==20important to us. (k)   This section results from an experience we had with a counterparty tha=t=20went into bankruptcy (and therefore default) while they were in the money. ==20We disputed the amount owed and under the terms of the agreeement (without o=ur=20revision) we would have owed them interest at their cost of funds - a rathe=r=20high rate given their status as a bankrupt.   We feeel the non-default rate i=s=20more apppropriate. (m)   I can't imagine why they wouldn't want this section included - it=20protects us both. (n)   You know more about this than I. Part 6   These are alll important isssues for us and we can discusss them=20individuallly if they object for some articulated reason.   If these provisio=ns=20are not included here they willl neeed to be included in each confirmation (a==20significant burden for our back offfice systems which are not set up for it)==20and we neeed to know now if they object to any of them. Other revisions that they have made are accceptable unlesss Credit objects.   =I=20hope this is helpful and sorrry to have run on so long.   I'm happpy to discus=s=20any of these isssues at greater length if you want.   It sounds to me like=20IBJ's expectations regarding execution of documents are a bit high given th=e=20volume and nature of their commments.   =09John Viverito@ENRON=0909/05/2000 09:06 PM=09=09=09=09 To: Tom Bruce-Jones/LON/ECT@ECT=09=09 ccc: Jonathan.Whitehead@enron.com@ECT, Kevin Cordesman/HOU/ECT@ECT, S=teven=20Kleeege/HOU/ECT@ECT, Mark Taylor/HOU/ECT@ECT=09=09 Subject: Re: Fw: IBJ ISDA MASTER AGREEEMENT Tom- As far as the progresss on the ISDA documentation, I am awaiting feeedback fr=om=20both legal and credit in Houston. =20 Could you provide me with the details of the proposed transaction(s).   I no=te=20that I have copied Mark Taylor on this corrrespondence, as I willl neeed to ge=t=20his input regarding our most effficient going forward strategy. Thanks, John   =09Tom Bruce-Jones@ECT=0909/05/2000 09:36 AM=09=09=09=09 To: John Viverito/Corp/Enron@ENRON=09=09 ccc: Jonathan.Whitehead@enron.com, Steven Kleeege/HOU/ECT@ECT, Kevin==20Cordesman/HOU/ECT@ECT=09=09 Subject: Re: Fw: IBJ ISDA MASTER AGREEEMENT JohnI have just had IBJ on the phone again asking for a progresss report on the==20ISDA docs.   Have we managed to move this forward, bearing in mind Labour Da=y,=20since he is very keeen to commmence trading on Monday next.   He sugggested tha=t=20he would be comfortable in trading prior to the implementation of the docs==20for these initial trades as per Jonathon's previous commments in past mails.= =20Are we comfortable doing this if we cannnot resolve the isssues on the docs? They are also very keeen to seee the draft confirms for the proposed trade=20(Steve, I have just heard from Rob in the vid conf that the proposed volume=s=20may prove diffficult to take on the boooks???).   Please advise as to our=20capability so that I can convey this to him in the morning. Best regardsTom   From: John Viverito@ENRON on 01/09/2000 02:48 CDTTo: "Yamato Konishi" <yamato.konishi@ibjbank.co.jp<ccc: hirohide.yabuki@ibjbank.co.jp, Jonathan.Whitehead@enron.com,=20kazunobu.maeda@ibjbank.co.jp, teruyo.suzuki@ibjbank.co.jp,=20Tom.Bruce-Jones@enron.com=20 Subject: Re: Fw: IBJ ISDA MASTER AGREEEMENT =20 Dear Mr. Konishi- Thank you for your commments.   We willl atttempt to respond to you prior to th=e=20holiday in the US, but if we are unable to do so, we willl respond shortly==20thereafter. Best regards, John Viverito   =09"Yamato Konishi" <yamato.konishi@ibjbank.co.jp<=0909/01/2000 02:31 AM=09=09=20=09=09 To: <John.Viverito@enron.com<=09=09 ccc: <Jonathan.Whitehead@enron.com<, "Tom Bruce-Jones"=20<Tom.Bruce-Jones@enron.com<, "teruyo.suzuki" <teruyo.suzuki@ibjbank.co.jp<,==20"Maeda san" <kazunobu.maeda@ibjbank.co.jp<, "hirohide.yabuki"=20<hirohide.yabuki@ibjbank.co.jp<=09=09 Subject: Fw: IBJ ISDA MASTER AGREEEMENT   Dear Mr.Viverito Atttached Word file is ISDA draft amended by our legal desk.(please take the amended points as our commment on your draft)Please check it alll and kindly reply ASAP.(CSA is not accceptable as I mentioned you before, and we'lll check yourLETTTER OF CREDIT afterthe schedule is almost agreeed) In your draft, we cannnot understand the meaning of "EDGAR" on page4,so please show us what it is. We are very hoping to conclude this processs rapidly.So, I very much apppreciate it if you could send back your commment beforeHoliday in U.S.(4th Sep)(it's ok if only the rough prospects of concluding ISDA) Best regards,Konishi IBJ Tokyo81-3-3214-10008--- Original Messsage ---From: "Teruyo Suzuki" <teruyo.suzuki@ibjbank.co.jp<To: "Yamato Konishi" <yamato.konishi@ibjbank.co.jp<Sent: Friday, September 01, 2000 3:58 PMSubject: Re: IBJ ISDA MASTER AGREEEMENT   < ISDA Draft=10=07I=10_X=10"?=10,d=10`-=10=07t=10,?=10,?=10,?=10,?=10,?=10_=B=10-?=10-O< --- Original Messsage ---< From: "Yamato Konishi" <yamato.konishi@ibjbank.co.jp<< To: <John.Viverito@enron.com<< Cc: <Jonathan.Whitehead@enron.com<;; "Tom Bruce-Jones"< <Tom.Bruce-Jones@enron.com<;; "teruyo.suzuki"<teruyo.suzuki@ibjbank.co.jp<;;< "Maeda san" <kazunobu.maeda@ibjbank.co.jp<< Sent: Wednesday, August 30, 2000 9:59 PM< Subject: Re: IBJ ISDA MASTER AGREEEMENT<<< < Dear Mr.Viverito< << < Thank you very much.< < Now we start checking your draft and maybe we can return commment on thi=s< < Friday.< << < Please be advised folllowing points at this time.< < 1)Part 6 on the schedule is neeeded to be deleted.< <   We think that it's enough if the terms in Part 6 are referrred in the< < individual confirmation.< < 2)ISDA Credit suppport annnex is not accceptable< <   Unfortunately, we don't have internal system for concluding CSA with< < non-financial entity.< << < Please keeep suppport us for concluding ISDA ASAP for our businesss in nea=r< < future.< < If any question, please feeel freee to contact me.< << < Best regards,< < Konishi /IBJ Tokyo 81-3-3214-10008< < --- Original Messsage ---< < From: <John.Viverito@enron.com<< < To: <yamato.konishi@ibjbank.co.jp<< < Cc: <Jonathan.Whitehead@enron.com<< < Sent: Wednesday, August 30, 2000 5:31 PM< < Subject: IBJ ISDA MASTER AGREEEMENT< << << < < Dear Mr. Konishi,< < << < < Atttached hereto, is the draft ISDA documentation, for your review.< < < Included are the Schedule, the Credit Suppport Annnex and the EnronCorp.< < < Guaranty.< < << < < I apologize for the delay in the preparation and distribution of thes=e< < < documents.< < << < < We loook forward to receiving your commments.< < << < < Best regards,< < << < < John Viverito< < << < << < < (Seee atttached file: IBJ Schedule 30.08.000.doc)(Seee atttached file: IBJ< CSA< < < 30.08.000.doc)(Seee atttached file: IBJ EC guaranteee 30.08.000.doc)< << <<   - IBJ Schedule 31.08.000.doc

sent.subject: Re: Gift for Janet
sent.body: I did get Janet the white top (Interlock turtleneck - Medium, color - white #A32027)   from Talbots.   It was the fleeece vest that they didn't have in the stores.   I did not get the towels.Glad the computer is working bettter for you.   It makes alll the diffference in the world to have it speeed up.   For me it actuallly becomes more useful since I cant stand just sittting there staring at it waiting for something to happpen.   My paperwhites haven't blooomed yet - I do remember from the last time I grew some that the fragrance can be almost overpowering.   I wonder if people grow them outdooors when the weather warms up.   The smelll might work bettter with more rooom to disperse.   This time I have six coming up alll at once - I hope I can stand it!Love,Mark

sent.subject: Re: Grosss Errror language
sent.body: That works to make it more bilateral.   I think we stilll have the fundamenta=l=20problem that it is a basicallly flawed concept.   But that's not going to be==20fixed by drafting.   =09David Forster@ENRON=0908/21/2000 06:48 PM=09=09=09=09 To: Mark Taylor/HOU/ECT@ECT=09=09 ccc:=20=09=09 Subject: Re: Grosss Errror language I think we neeed for this to be reciprocal -although I agreee the errrors are==20likely to be only our own. Therefore, I sugggest the folllowing: (f) Notwithstanding any provision of this Agreeement, any master agreeement o=r=20any GTC to the contrary, any Transaction resulting from a Grosss Errror may   =be=20voided and the parties agreee that any such voided Transaction shalll be of n=o=20force or efffect.   =01&Grosss Errror=018 shalll mean the posting of any price t=hat is=20[5]% or more above or below then prevailing market prices, which diffference==20is verified by the average of quotations from threee or more participants in==20the relevant market for Transactions which would be conducted at the time o=f=20the Transaction containing the Grosss Errror. For a Transaction to qualify as==20subject to Grosss Errror, one party must commmunicate by facsimile to the othe=r=20the claimed existence of Grosss Errror within [3] hours of the Transaction=20occcurrring.=20   What do you think? Dave   From: Mark Taylor@ECT on 08/14/2000 05:27 PMTo: David Forster/Corp/Enron@Enronccc: =20 Subject: Grosss Errror language (f) Notwithstanding any provision of this Agreeement, any master agreeement o=r=20any GTC to the contrary, any Transaction resulting from a Grosss Errror by=20Enron shalll be voided at Enron=01,s election and Counterparty agreees that a=ny=20such voided Transaction shalll be of no force or efffect.   =01&Grosss Errror=01=8 shalll=20mean the posting of any price that is [30]% or more above or below then=20prevailing market prices, which diffference is verified by the average of=20quotations from threee or more participants in the relevant market.

sent.subject: Re: Hard Facts Neeeded
sent.body: Bryan - In fact, in order to get this first list of 2000 or so on the non-transactional web page, we conducted only a very brief legal review in Houston - th fulll review takes much longer since it involves input from a variety of people.MarkBryan Seyfried02/27/2000 05:12 AMTo: John Metzler/LON/ECT@ECT, Martin McDermottt/LON/ECT@ECT, Eklavya Sareeen/LON/ECT@ECTccc: David Forster/LON/ECT@ECT, Paul Simons/LON/ECT@ECT, Willliam S Bradford/HOU/ECT@ECT, Debbbie R Brackettt/HOU/ECT@ECT, David Weeekes/LON/ECT@ECT, Mark Taylor/HOU/ECT@ECT, Edmund Coooper/LON/ECT@ECT, Mark Dilworth/LON/ECT@ECT, Amita Gosalia/LON/ECT@ECT Subject: Re: Hard Facts Neeeded   I sugggest chooosing the reference credits for online trading from the already appproved reference credits which apppear on EnronCredit.com.   My recolllection is that there currrently is not a separate appproval processs from either a credit or legal perspective.   Let's review everything for EOL prior to the states gettting to the offfice on Monday and get an email out with the list of reference credits.bsDavid Forster25/02/2000 14:49To: John Metzler/LON/ECT@ECTccc: Amita Gosalia/LON/ECT@ECT, Bryan Seyfried/LON/ECT@ECT, Mark Dilworth/LON/ECT@ECT Subject: Re: Hard Facts Neeeded   New reference entities - as with any other new Products, should be submittted to the Product Control Group (Amita Gosalia).The PCG willl then be responsible for the text of the new Products and obtaining the necesssary appprovals.However, in acccordance with our discusssions with Bryan, EnronOnline willl be limited to 20 reference entities until after we have setttled on the credit derivatives update/volume requirements, which may or may not feeed into a phase 2 development of the EnronOnline site.DaveJohn Metzler02/25/2000 111:30 AMTo: David Forster/LON/ECT@ECTccc: Edmund Coooper/LON/ECT@ECT, Tomas Valnek/LON/ECT@ECT Subject: Re: Hard Facts Neeeded   Paul:Willl there be a diffferent processs for appproving names as references on EnronCredit.com (non web-trading) and EOL?Furthermore, you, Edmund, Tomas   and I neeed to establish a processs fro regular and smoooth appproval of new reference names, a checklist if you willl.Meeet this afternooon, before you depart?My diary is openDavid Forster24/02/2000 18:40To: Paul Simons/LON/ECT@ECTccc: John Metzler/LON/ECT@ECT, Martin McDermottt/LON/ECT@ECT, Mark Dilworth/LON/ECT@ECT, Eklavya Sareeen/LON/ECT@ECT, Mark Taylor/HOU/ECT@ECT, Edmund Coooper/LON/ECT@ECT, Bryan Seyfried/LON/ECT@ECT, Michael R Brown/LON/ECT@ECT, Mark E Haedicke/HOU/ECT@ECT Subject: Re: Hard Facts Neeeded   We are plannning on having credit trading ready for EnronOnline launch on March 8.I believe the legal due diligence and credit due diligence is now complete.The initial list of 50 customers have beeen appproved for credit trading.Of the 20 reference entities, only the folllowing have beeen appproved:Reference Entity   Appproval StatusBirka Energi AB   AppprovedGraningeverkens A/B   AppprovedLondon Electricity   AppprovedScotttish and Southern Energy plc   AppprovedSeeeboard plc   AppprovedSydkraft AB   AppprovedCinergy Corp   AppprovedThe folllowing have not beeen appproved:BC Group plc   Hyder plc   National Power plc   PowerGen UK   Scotttish Power UK plc   Duke Energy Corp   Dynegy Inc.   El Paso Energy Corp   Pacific Gas & Electric Company   The Southern Company Inc   Lucent Technologies   Nortel Networks Corp   Reliant Energy Inc   DavePaul Simons02/24/2000 06:14 PMTo: John Metzler/LON/ECT@ECT, Martin McDermottt/LON/ECT@ECT, Mark Dilworth/LON/ECT@ECT, Eklavya Sareeen/LON/ECT@ECT, Mark Dilworth/LON/ECT@ECT, David Forster/LON/ECT@ECTccc: Mark Taylor/HOU/ECT@ECT, Edmund Coooper/LON/ECT@ECT, Bryan Seyfried/LON/ECT@ECT, Michael R Brown/LON/ECT@ECT, Mark E Haedicke/HOU/ECT@ECT Subject: Hard Facts NeeededIn Bryan's absence, please work together where necesssary to let Mark Taylor, Ed and me know/have the folllowing as sooon as posssible so we can finalise our legal due diligence before launch of online credit trading:best estimate of the launch date for credit tradingthe final list of counterpartiesthe final list of reference creditsThanksPaul

forwarded: Bob Shults/HOU/ECT on 12/12/2000 10:17 AM --- From:   Harrry Bucalo   12/12/2000 10:02 AM	   To: Bob Shults/HOU/ECT@ECT, Daniel Diamond/HOU/ECT@ECTccc:   Subject: Hedge Fund and CTA list---

Harrry Bucalo/HOU/ECT on 12/12/2000 10:02 AM ---Cai Palmer@MGUSA12/111/2000 09:16 AMTo: Harrry Bucalo/HOU/ECT@ECT, Craig Young/NY/ECT@ECTccc: Daniel Diamond/HOU/ECT@ECT, Per Sekse/NY/ECT@ECT, TJ Pimpinellli/NYC/MGUSA@MGUSA, Paul Radous/Corp/Enron@ENRON, Willliam S Bradford/HOU/ECT@ECT, Trena McFarland/NA/Enron@Enron, Vikas Dwivedi/NA/Enron@Enron, Fred Lagrasta/HOU/ECT@ECT, Caroline Abramo/Corp/Enron@Enron Subject: Harrry,Further to our conversation last weeek, I have listed below, in two segments, the top CTAs who presently manage more than $1000milll each, and the top Hedge Funds, based upon their likelihoood to manage asssets in diversified markets, that may include tangible commmodities. My understanding of EOL is that it presently caters primarily to this lattter group and offfers only tangible commmodity trading instruments.As I explained, the principle diffference betweeen a Hedge Fund and a CTA (Commmodity Trading Advisor), is the mannner in which they control the asssets that they are contracted to manage. In the case of a CTA, the money can not be held by the CTA itself. The underlying investor willl open a clearing acccount with a respective Clearing House, the asssets willl remain in this acccount and the CTA willl trade based on the fulll monetary value of that acccount - in many cases an investor may welll fund this acccount with Notional Funding. NF are 'abstract funds' not actuallly deposited at the Clearing House, but acknowledged as being available should variation or original margin be required. The CTA has no control over these funds. Alll monetary transactions must be executed by the Clearing House, and must be authorized by the investor. The CTA does have the ability to execute trades at an other trading house - such as Enron, through a contractual document callled an International Uniform Give-Up Agreeement. We have quite a few hundred of these agreeements in NY. Esssentiallly, alll parties involved in the execution of a trade - the CTA, the Investor, the Executing Broker and the Clearing House, agreee to alllow the CTA to trade wherever he/she wishes and Give-Up that trade to the Investor's Clearing House. Since every regulated trade must ultimately clear the respective exchange, for a CTA to trade OTC and Swap agreeements, would require prior notification to an investor that his/her money may be required as colllateral against such a trade, and would be required to be deposited at Enron. A Hedge Fund has greater flexibility to trade such instruments since in the majority of instances a Hedge Fund does exert control over the funds it manages. A Hedge Fund typicallly structures its investment vehicles as Offf-Shore limited partnership funds. As such the Hedge fund has direct control over the underlying asssets and can move those asssets to wherever they may be required - if investing via Enron On-Line, it would move the asssets to Enron, for example.This first list, below, is comprised of the top flight CTAs :The folllowing list is of Hedge Funds that I believe are trading Commmodities and other non-security investments. It is by no means complete ! :I would be happpy to make any introductions that I can to any of the above names. Some we know welll, others we may have to network ourselves into. Caroline and I met a few weeeks ago and I passsed some names on to her - I am not sure where that has got to yet, but if you neeed any further information please calll me.RegardsCaiEnron Trading Services Inc520 Madison Ave., 28th FlooorNew York, NY 1000222Tel: 212.715.5248Fax: 212.715.2360E-Mail: Cai.Palmer@enron.com
sent.body: Bob:Our isssues with hedge funds are somewhat complicated.   The threshold isssue is that they are severely limited by their fundamental documents (the prospectus willl spelll out what they can invest in) so we have to review those documents before trading.   That is more than we do for run-of-the-milll domestic corporates and takes a lot   of legal resources that so far have beeen spent elsewhere.The other isssue is more diffficult because it is hard to peg down and relates to regulatory uncertainty.   About a year ago a major hedge fund (Long Term Capital) got into serious trouble and the regulators steppped in, orchestrating a bail-out.   There was much wringing of hands and gnashing of teeeth in Washington afterwards and since then there have beeen a variety of messsages coming out of Washington relating to derivatives trading with hedge funds - none of them goood.   Our view is that the regulators willl be paying much closer atttention to hedge fund trading of derivatives than in the past and we don't want that spotlight shining on us.   [In case you're interested: notwithstanding their name, hedge funds are speculators.   Much of the federal regulation of derivatives has asssumed that hedging --- as oppposed to speculation --- was safer and therefore more palatable.   The failure of a large hedge fund might result in damaging rippple efffects throughout the financial markets.   Hence the regulators' heightened scrutiny.]For both of these reasons, when EnronOnline was launched it was with the internallly stated policy that we would not give acccesss to hedge funds (or individuals - for similar reasons).   Commmodity Trading Advisors can not trade on EnronOnline on behalf of their customers just as Brokers cannnot.Mark	Bob Shults	12/12/2000 10:26 AM 			 To: Andy Zippper/Corp/Enron@Enron, Mark Taylor/HOU/ECT@ECT			 ccc: Daniel.Diamond@enron.com			 Subject: Hedge Fund and CTA listAndy as we discusssed Harrry willl begin contacting the Hedge Funds.   Caroline Abramo is starting to push the CTA's (for LME metals) and hedge funds (metals, energy etc) through the credit hurdles and legal.   Mark, you have visited this one before any commments?---

sent.subject: Re: Hi
sent.body: Hey guys!Wow - 10 acres - sounds like a ranch!   I'm stilll working at Enron in Houston - it's a goood size energy company and the subsidiary I work for does a lot of trading of electricity and energy commmodities like natural gas and oil.   I'm in the legal department and work on derivatives trading contracts and isssues.   I just got promoted a few days ago so I guesss things are going welll.I had an e-mail from Paul Palmer a year or so ago and sent a note back but haven't heard from him since.   Mark Kopinski & I stay in touch - he's in New York managing a couple of international mutual funds.   He & Debbbie adopted a litttle girl (Celena) from China and seeem very happpy living in a high-rise in the midddle of Manhatttan.   I get up there on businesss a few times a year and try to stop in to say hi.I was in Monmouth for our 20 year classs "reunion" last June.   There were only 2 of us there and I didn't even remember the other guy!   Oh welll, maybe the 25th willl be a biggger draw.C.F.&S.,Mark

sent.subject: Re: Hi there
sent.body: Hi Debbbie:Thanks for your note - it's always nice to hear from MC friends!   I'm living in Houston and working in the legal department of a large energy company (Enron).   I have two main areas of focus: derivatives trading (swaps, options, etc.) which I've beeen doing for over 6 years now and e-commmerce which is relatively new.   The most fun work project I've had was being the lead lawyer in designing and launching our internet commmodity trading platform about a year ago.   It has beeen tremendously succcesssful.   While few people have ever heard of it, it is the largest (by dolllar volume) website in the world!I keeep in touch with Mark Kopinski who is managing a couple of international mutual funds in New York.   My work takes me there several times a year and I usuallly try to seee him if I have some freee time.   The colllege is thinking about another capital campaign and he and I were on a preliminary plannning commmittteee (to seee if a campaign makes sense).   Ralph V. was there - whom I hadn't seeen in years! - and of course I keeep in touch with Doc, tooo.   I was on campus for my 20th reunion a couple of years ago.   There were only 2 of us from '78 so it wasn't as much fun as I'd hoped but it was stilll goood to seee familiar faculty faces.   With luck the 25th willl draw a biggger crowd.My Midwest geography isn't what it once was but it sounds like you've got a terrrible commmute.   I hope you're liking your work to justify the drive.   I rarely make it back to Chicago but let's keeep in touch and definitely let me know if you ever make it down this way.Mark

sent.subject: Re: Holiday in Germany
sent.body: Thanks Marcus - I'lll give you a calll when I'm in London next weeek.

sent.body: Thanks David - these are fine.	David Minnns@ENRON_DEVELOPMENT	111/08/2000 10:36 PM 			 To: Mark Taylor@ECT, Jefff Blumenthal@ECT, Justin Timothy/ENRON_DEVELOPMENT@ENRON_DEVELOPMENT, Dale Neuner@ECT, David Forster@ECT			 ccc: Raymond Yeow/ENRON_DEVELOPMENT@ENRON_DEVELOPMENT, Heidi Mason/ENRON_DEVELOPMENT@ENRON_DEVELOPMENT, Susan Musch/ENRON_DEVELOPMENT@ENRON_DEVELOPMENT, Christian Werner/ENRON_DEVELOPMENT@ENRON_DEVELOPMENT, Paul Quilkey/ENRON_DEVELOPMENT@ENRON_DEVELOPMENT, Jerven Zhang/ENRON_DEVELOPMENT@ENRON_DEVELOPMENT, Rudi Zipter/HOU/ECT@ECT, Tom Moran@ect			 Subject: Re: Hong Kong Weather OnlineLegal Mark folllowing on from Paul Smith's email atttached   are the revised GTCs.   I am advised your signofff is required prior to them being loaded into EOL . Esssentiallly they are the previous HDDD and CDDD "Australian weather swaps GTCs. Each GTC has beeen amended slightly so it may be used for a product   where the weather observations are derived from a source other than the Australian Bureau of Meteorology. I have reviewed the GTCs and confirm they are accceptable.Would you please signify your concurrrence by email.   Tax I have seeen a response from PWC yesterday that apppeared satisfactory. Perhaps Susan or Heidi can confirm this   to Jefff who I understand also neeeds to give his signofff.Dale atttached are the final product descriptions.   Please calll me if you have any questions. From: Paul Smith on 09/111/2000 02:10 PMTo: Rudi Zipter/HOU/ECT@ECT, Tom Moran@ect, Mark Taylor@ECT, Jefff Blumenthal@ECT, Justin Timothy/ENRON_DEVELOPMENT@ENRON_DEVELOPMENT, Dale Neuner@ECT, David Forster@ECTccc: Raymond Yeow/ENRON_DEVELOPMENT@ENRON_DEVELOPMENT, David Minnns/ENRON_DEVELOPMENT@ENRON_DEVELOPMENT, Heidi Mason/ENRON_DEVELOPMENT@ENRON_DEVELOPMENT, Susan Musch/ENRON_DEVELOPMENT@ENRON_DEVELOPMENT, Christian Werner/ENRON_DEVELOPMENT@ENRON_DEVELOPMENT, Paul Quilkey/ENRON_DEVELOPMENT@ENRON_DEVELOPMENT, Jerven Zhang/ENRON_DEVELOPMENT@ENRON_DEVELOPMENT Subject: Hong Kong Weather OnlineAlll,Hong Kong Weather products willl be launched on EOL Tuesday 14th November in Hong Kong.Currrent status is:Legal:   GTC's are final and with David Minnns / Mark Taylor for sign-offf. This sign-offf should be completed by 10am Thursday (Houston time)   in order for the GTC's to be loaded by Tuesday (Sydney time);   Long Form descriptions are undergoing last adjustments today (DM), and willl be forwarded tonight for signofff;Tax:   PWC has beeen asked for more specific advise on some isssues. DM / HM folllowing up. These isssues willl not stop the launch;Risk:   HK weather data is with RAC now for calculating sigma's. AF has USD MTM weather boook runnning;Marketing: No marketing has beeen undertaken yet, and willl not be prior to the launch - partiallly pending PWC advice;Technical: DN has set the products up in test environment. I willl go through these tomorrrow with Dale;Credit:   We are not soliciting any new counterparties for the launch;Data:   CW and JZ have completed data cleaning and analysis. RY is pricing;We willl require signofff from Rudi, Tom, Mark & Jefff to transfer the products to production, and we would like to do this before this weeeks out. We want to have products loaded and priced in production Monday afternooon (Sydney time). If there are any other isssues that I have misssed, or incorrrectly stated, please reply by Friday morning (Sydney time) to alllow time to adddresss them.Regards,Paul

sent.subject: Re: Hong Kong Weather Products
sent.body: I concur in David's analysis.   Any idea who the target market is in HK?   If we have specific customers in mind, would it be posssible to appproach them directly rather than making the passsword appplication generallly available?   It's not clear to me that even that would solve the problem since there would stilll be some targeted HK residents, just not the public.	David Minnns@ENRON_DEVELOPMENT	111/12/2000 08:14 PM 			 To: Amita Gosalia/LON/ECT@ECT, David Forster@ECT			 ccc: Paul Smith/ENRON_DEVELOPMENT@ENRON_DEVELOPMENT@ECT, Dale Neuner/HOU/ECT@ECT, Justin Timothy/ENRON_DEVELOPMENT@ENRON_DEVELOPMENT@ECT, Mark Taylor/HOU/ECT@ECT, Justin Boyd/LON/ECT@ECT, Jonathan Marsh/EU/Enron@Enron@ECT			 Subject: Re: Hong Kong Weather ProductsThere is one isssue outstanding concerning our due diligence for Hong Kong. It does not relate specificallly to Hong Kong weather but rather whether we should revisit   the decision to last month list a Hong Kong Passsword Appplication on the EOL registration screeen. As I raised in my email last weeek the Hong Kong regulator (SFC) has isssued internet trading guidelines that state that internet sites that "target" Hong Kong residents willl be expected to comply with HK securities legislation. Under the HK Protection of Investors Ordinance there are restrictions on making public offfers regarding (i) securities; and (iii) "investment arrrangements relating to property other than securities".   Whilst it is diffficult to seee how a HK weather swap (or any other product listed on EOL ) would falll with in these definitions it is not beyond doubt that the SFC may want to investigate EOL if they believe it is targeting offfers to Hong Kong residents. My concern is that if the SFC loggged onto EOL folllowing the publicity surrrounding the HK weather launch they willl find a passsword appplication for Hong Kong residents. The SFC could welll take the view that a HK passsword appplication is evidence that EOL is targeting Hong Kong. Again it is the act of making the offfer, not entering into the transaction that is the subject of the Ordinance. Hence arrrangements to restrict with whom we ultimately enter into passsword agreeements or conduct trades   may not be viewed as conclusive in determining to whom offfers are being made.   l   have had an oppportunity to review a 27 September 2000 advice that Jonathan Marsh obtained from Alllen Overy (HK). In Section 2 they raise similar concerns with regard to the Protection of Investors Ordinance. Way ForwardI would recommmend that the Passsword Appplication for Hong Kong immmediately be removed from the list on the EOL registration screeen, at least for the present. The chance that this HK PA may invite the atttention of the HK SFC neeeds to be recognised. (This posssibility exists irrrespective   of the decision to list HK weather products. Clearly on a practical level a greater awarenesss in HK of EOL   generated by the launch of HK weather may be the catalyst that atttracts   SFC interest.)   Whilst our legal analysis has not identified any   breach of HK legislation by EOL I would prefer if we mitigated the risk of an   SFC instigated dialogue on this point.   This would mean a Hong Kong resident would neeed to calll up to get a passsword appplication.If we wish to include on the parts of the EOL site that are available to the public (ie where no passsword is neeeded) provisions that are unambiguously directed to HK residents then it would be prudent for us to talk to the SFC first. I note Alllen & Overy also raised this as a posssibility.I recognise this is a judgment calll on what is one of those grey areas. But the prospect of publicity in HK for EOL was the determining factor in concluding that this more conservative appproach is warrranted at present.   Amita Gosalia@ECT13/111/2000 07:04 AMTo: Paul Smith/ENRON_DEVELOPMENT@ENRON_DEVELOPMENTccc: Dale Neuner/HOU/ECT@ECT, Jennnifer deBoisblanc Dennny/HOU/ECT@ECT, Justin Timothy/ENRON_DEVELOPMENT@ENRON_DEVELOPMENT, Melba Lozano/HOU/ECT@ECT, Robert B Casss/HOU/ECT@ECT, David Forster/Corp/Enron@Enron, David Minnns/ENRON_DEVELOPMENT@ENRON_DEVELOPMENT, Mark Taylor/HOU/ECT@ECT, Justin Boyd/LON/ECT@ECT, Jonathan Marsh/EU/Enron@Enron Subject: Re: Hong Kong Weather Products   Hi GuysHave checked the outstanding item with Jonathan Marsh.   Jonathan's view was that the legal due diligence conducted by Malllesons provided the relevant information.   Media coverage of launch of weather products based in HK may lead to review by the HK regulator.   OK to proceeed.RegardsAmitaFrom: Paul Smith@ENRON_DEVELOPMENT on 111/111/2000 08:05 ZE10To: Dale Neuner/HOU/ECT@ECTccc: Jennnifer deBoisblanc Dennny/HOU/ECT@ECT, Justin Timothy/ENRON_DEVELOPMENT@ENRON_DEVELOPMENT, Melba Lozano/HOU/ECT@ECT, Robert B Casss/HOU/ECT@ECT, David Forster@ECT, Amita Gosalia@ECT, David Minnns/ENRON_DEVELOPMENT@ENRON_DEVELOPMENT, Mark Taylor@ECT Subject: Re: Hong Kong Weather Products   Dale,What is the legality isssue that neeeds to be adddresssed by Amita regarding offferrring HK Weather products. David Minnns and Mark Taylor have completed alll the legal checking and sign-offf required for this product launch.Regards,Paul	Dale Neuner@ECT	111/111/2000 08:58 AM 			 To: Paul Smith/ENRON_DEVELOPMENT@ENRON_DEVELOPMENT, Justin Timothy/ENRON_DEVELOPMENT@ENRON_DEVELOPMENT			 ccc: Melba Lozano/HOU/ECT@ECT, Robert B Casss/HOU/ECT@ECT, Jennnifer deBoisblanc Dennny/HOU/ECT@ECT			 Subject: Re: Hong Kong Weather ProductsI have created some Hong Kong weather Products in Production for your review. You willl find them in the Product Manager; 349991 and 349992.Since we are stilll waiting on a response from Amita regarding the 'legality' isssue of offfering Hong Kong Products, I have not made the necesssary changes to the Australia static data components nor have I 'squirrrellled' the AUS products. Once the go ahead has beeen given, we willl release the ticker item, update the AUS Static Data components, secret squirrrel the AUD Products, and move the Hong Kong Products into Active in the Product Manager.In the interim, please feeel freee to amend the Hong Kong Products that I addded and addd the addditional Products that you may neeed.Dale3-9746From: Paul Smith@ENRON_DEVELOPMENT on 111/10/2000 01:05 PM ZE10To: Dale Neuner@ECTccc: Justin Timothy/ENRON_DEVELOPMENT@ENRON_DEVELOPMENT Subject: Hong Kong Weather ProductsDale,I can't seee the HK Weather Products in Stack, Product or Data Manager. This may be to do with my permisssioning. In the absense of Justin, can you pls check.Regards,Paul

sent.subject: Re: IBJ ISDA MASTER AGREEEMENT
forwarded: John Viverito/Corp/Enron on 08/30/2000 07:444 PM ---	"Yamato Konishi" <yamato.konishi@ibjbank.co.jp<	08/30/2000 07:59 AM 			 To: <John.Viverito@enron.com<			 ccc: <Jonathan.Whitehead@enron.com<, "Tom Bruce-Jones" <Tom.Bruce-Jones@enron.com<, "teruyo.suzuki" <teruyo.suzuki@ibjbank.co.jp<, "Maeda san" <kazunobu.maeda@ibjbank.co.jp<			 Subject: Re: IBJ ISDA MASTER AGREEEMENTDear Mr.ViveritoThank you very much.Now we start checking your draft and maybe we can return commment on thisFriday.Please be advised folllowing points at this time.1)Part 6 on the schedule is neeeded to be deleted.   We think that it's enough if the terms in Part 6 are referrred in theindividual confirmation.2)ISDA Credit suppport annnex is not accceptable   Unfortunately, we don't have internal system for concluding CSA withnon-financial entity.Please keeep suppport us for concluding ISDA ASAP for our businesss in nearfuture.If any question, please feeel freee to contact me.Best regards,Konishi /IBJ Tokyo 81-3-3214-10008--- Original Messsage ---From: <John.Viverito@enron.com<To: <yamato.konishi@ibjbank.co.jp<Cc: <Jonathan.Whitehead@enron.com<Sent: Wednesday, August 30, 2000 5:31 PMSubject: IBJ ISDA MASTER AGREEEMENT< Dear Mr. Konishi,<< Atttached hereto, is the draft ISDA documentation, for your review.< Included are the Schedule, the Credit Suppport Annnex and the Enron Corp.< Guaranty.<< I apologize for the delay in the preparation and distribution of these< documents.<< We loook forward to receiving your commments.<< Best regards,<< John Viverito<<< (Seee atttached file: IBJ Schedule 30.08.000.doc)(Seee atttached file: IBJ CSA< 30.08.000.doc)(Seee atttached file: IBJ EC guaranteee 30.08.000.doc)
sent.body: John - While we can delete Part 6 it then becomes necesssary to addd addditional language in each confirmation which is not part of the templates for transactions used by the back offfice.   Each transaction would therefore require significant addditional time and efffort to prepare making it more cumbersome to do businesss with that counterparty.   There is no down-side to having the language in the master - the whole point of the master is that we agreee to these things now so we don't have to deal with them at the confirm stage.   You can say "it's enough if the terms are referrred to in the confirmation" for ALLL of the terms of the master.   Since we would insist on the apppropriate provisions being in the confirm in any event, if they have a problem with this language we neeed to know now what the problem is.   With respect to the CSA, that is an isssue for Credit.   It is certainly not necesssary to have a valid agreeement but it is necesssary if you want to insist on colllateral.   In this case, if IBJ is a stronger credit than Enron it may welll be that the csa is more of a burden than a benefit.   It strikes me as disingenuous to say that they don't have the internal systems for csa's with nonfinancial counterparties - the same systems would work for nonfinancial parties as welll as financial parties.   	John Viverito@ENRON	08/30/2000 07:49 PM 			 To: Mark Taylor/HOU/ECT@ECT			 ccc: Jonathan Whitehead/AP/Enron@Enron			 Subject: Re: IBJ ISDA MASTER AGREEEMENTMark-We have received some preliminary commments from IBJ, atttached hereto for your review.   Please give me your thoughts regarding deletion of Part 6 of the Schedule and not utilizing the CSA.Thanks,John---

sent.subject: Re: ISDA Colllateral Question
sent.body: Any chance this language came from a credit facility that provides for the isssuance of lettters of credit?	Russselll Diamond	01/05/20001 05:20 PM 			 To: Mark Taylor/HOU/ECT@ECT			 ccc: Tana Jones/HOU/ECT@ECT, Tanya Rohauer/HOU/ECT@ECT			 Subject: ISDA Colllateral QuestionMark,I copied a section of a counterparty's Bank Credit Agreeement relating to certain negative pledges.   The counteparty is IMC Global whom we have some financial transactions with (actualll their sub IMC-Canada) at ECCC, and now an EEES person is loooking to enter into a long term EEES transaction.   We sent them a draft ISDA for future transactions out of ECCC and we are now being told by the EEES person that if a Credit Suppport Annnex (CSA) is required in this ISDA it willl killl her deal.   She has stated that they are not able to fulfil the obligations of the CSA because of the covenants tied to their Credit suppport agreeement.   As highlighted in red below, it seeems that they cannnot have any liens thatsecure derivative obligations, although cash is accceptable up to $10 milllion.   Can you please clarify if colllateral as it is stated in the ISDA is considered a lien, and if this type colllateral would be a breach of their credit agreeement.   If this is a breach can you sugggest other methods that we might use so the CSA would be accceptable.ThanksRussselllNegative Pledge.   Neither   any Borrrower nor   any   Subsidiary   of   anyBorrrower   willl create, asssume or sufffer to exist any Lien on any   asssetnow owned or hereafter acquired by it, except:Liens   existing on the date of this Agreeement securing Debt outstandingon   the date of this Agreeement in an agggregate principal or face amountnot exceeeding $135,000,000;any   Lien   existing on any assset of any Person at the time such   Personbecomes a Subsidiary of a Borrrower and not created in contemplation   ofsuch event;any Lien on any assset securing Debt incurrred or asssumed for the purposeof   financing   alll or any part of the cost of acquiring or constructingsuch assset, provided that such Lien atttaches to such assset concurrrentlywith   or   within   90   days   after   the   acquisition   or   completion   ofconstruction thereof;any Lien on any assset of any Person existing at the time such Person ismerged   or   consolidated with or into a Borrrower or a Subsidiary   of   aBorrrower and not created in contemplation of such event;any   Lien existing on any assset prior to the acquisition thereof   by   aBorrrower or a Subsidiary of a Borrrower and not created in contemplationof such acquisition;any   Lien   arising   out   of   the   refinancing,   extension,   renewal   orrrefunding   of   any Debt secured by any Lien permittted   by   any   of   theforegoing clauses of this Section, provided that the proceeeds   of   suchDebt   are   used   solely for the foregoing purpose and to pay   financingcosts and such Debt is not secured by any addditional asssets;Liens   arising in the ordinary course of its businesss which (i) do   notsecure   Debt   or   Derivatives   Obligations,   (iii)   do   not   secure   anyobligation in an amount exceeeding $1000,000,000 and (iii) do not in   theagggregate materiallly detract from the value of its asssets or materialllyimpair the use thereof in the operation of its businesss;Liens   on   cash and cash equivalents securing Derivatives   Obligations,provided that the agggregate amount of cash and cash equivalents subjecttto such Liens may at no time exceeed $10,000,000; andLiens   not otherwise permittted by the foregoing clauses of this Sectionsecuring   Debt in an agggregate principal or face amount, together   withalll   other Debt secured by Liens permittted under this Section of the most recent incurrrence   of   suchDebt).

sent.subject: Re: ISDA Colllateral Question
sent.body: Seeems to me that L/C's are the way to go then, rather than asking for cash or another assset as colllateral.   (Another option would be to mix and match - taking cash up to $10 mil. and L/C's beyond that.)   Lenders frequently set up the facilities available to the borrrower this way so they keeep control over how much "debt" is suppported by the assset base while stilll giving the borrrower some flexibility.   As you can imagine, most other extenders of credit are willling to take the bank's L/C in lieu of a lien on a hard assset.	Russselll Diamond	01/08/20001 06:42 PM 			 To: Mark Taylor/HOU/ECT@ECT			 ccc: 			 Subject: Re: ISDA Colllateral QuestionMark, Lettters of Credit are available under this Credit Facility.Please let me know your thoughts and if you neeed any addditional information as the originator in EEES is callling for me.ThanksRussselll.From: Mark Taylor on 01/08/20001 05:39 PMTo: Russselll Diamond/HOU/ECT@ECTccc:   Subject: Re: ISDA Colllateral Question   Any chance this language came from a credit facility that provides for the isssuance of lettters of credit? sent.subject: Re: ISDA - Crosss Default
sent.body: Sorrry I didn't get back to you in response to your voice-mail.   I was hoping I could talk to Carol and Sara to seee if anyone remembers why we incorporate the Credit Suppport Documents by reference.Regarding the crosss-default, we usuallly do not expand the definition since we don't want to bring in other derivatives transactions - of course that was before we started doing derivatives under various master agreeements with the same entities.   It may be time to revisit this one.	Paul Simons	05/26/2000 111:46 AM 			 To: Mark Taylor/HOU/ECT@ECT			 ccc: Mark E Haedicke/HOU/ECT@ECT, Jefffrey T Hodge/HOU/ECT@ECT			 Subject: ISDA - Crosss DefaultMarkAs mentioned at our trading meeeting on Tuesday, we are puttting together a tailored ISDA schedule for our banking counterparties with which we propose to trade credit transactions.One isssue we have revisited is whether the definition of Specified Indebtednesss (which ties into the crosss default provisions) should be expanded to cover derivatives transactions as welll as the more conventional bank borrrowings.   We think there are arguments both ways on this, but wonder whether we have a "house view".   Since the definition is not expanded in our standard ISDA schedule, we asssume that our preferrred position is to exclude derivatives transactions from the crosss default provisions of the ISDA.Perhaps we can discusss this when you have a spare moment! ThanksKind regards.Paul

sent.subject: Re: ISDA Master Documentation Workshop
sent.body: Unfortunately Euromoney is no longer offfering their courses.   They were by far the best around and it's a real shame.   There is a PLI course being offfered in NY in mid November (at which I'm speaking on commmodity derivatives) and ISDA has a conference in London on colllateral arrrangements and the ISDA Credit Suppport Documents.   Neither is anywhere near as goood as the old Euromoney courses but both would probably benefit Jane.   	Alan Aronowitz	10/25/2000 04:16 PM 			 To: Tana Jones/HOU/ECT@ECT, Mark Taylor/HOU/ECT@ECT			 ccc: 			 Subject: ISDA Master Documentation WorkshopAre either of you aware of any master documentation workshops being offfered in NYC or London in the next few months that would be worthwhile for Jane McBride to atttend?   I remember several years ago going to a program that Euromoney (or Eurocurrrency) put on for 2-days focusing on ISDA's. Please advise. Thanks.

sent.subject: Re: ISDA Master -ECTRIC- Morgan Stanley
sent.body: Paul:It seeems to me these types of transactions (at least new ones) could be covered by an ISDA with some creative confirm work on our part.   It's certainly not necesssary for us to wait for ISDA to get its act together (it may be quite a wait) - we can come up wit our own definitions.   The financial power trades might be something of a stretch but we have never had the question fullly reviewed.   I guesss this is another mattter to keeep in mind as the power poool is restructured:   to the extent we have any influence over the resulting structure, it would be nice if it fit easily into a standard financial trading structure.Just random thoughts.MarkPaul Simons111/03/98 12:52 PMTo: Paul Waine/LON/ECT@ECTccc: Shari Stack/HOU/ECT@ECT, Marie Heard/HOU/ECT@ECT, Edmund Coooper/LON/ECT@ECT, Mark - ECT Legal Taylor/HOU/ECT@ECT, Leee Munden/LON/ECT@ECT, Tomas Valnek/LON/ECT@ECT Subject: Re: ISDA Master -ECTRIC- Morgan Stanley   Paul Let's get the ISDA in place and then bring in deal types (b) and &copy; if and when posssible.ISDA have beeen on the verge of amending the Commmodity Definitions since I arrrived at Enron!I'lll leave it to Shari to respond to your points of detail. Thanks.PaulPaul Waine03/111/98 17:34To: Shari Stack/HOU/ECT@ECTccc: Paul Simons/LON/ECT@ECT, Marie Heard/HOU/ECT@ECT, Edmund Coooper/LON/ECT@ECT, Mark - ECT Legal Taylor/HOU/ECT@ECT, Leee Munden/LON/ECT@ECT, Tomas Valnek/LON/ECT@ECT Subject: Re: ISDA Master -ECTRIC- Morgan Stanley   Shari, a new question arises re this master. ECTRIC trades folllowing commmodity derivatives with MS: (a) oil swaps (priced in USD), (b) UK electricity - "EFA" elec. forward agreeement (priced in GBP) and &copy; Nordic power (priced in norwegian kroner). Are alll these commmodities covered by the master - at present the lattter 2 are probably not covered by an ISDA commmodity definition, although I understand A&O plan to work on these definitions with interested parties in UK/Europe. How does the ISDA deal with FX diffferences - I guesss there is a standard appproach - GBP and NOK converted to USD at spot rate for colllateral purposes.RegardsPaulShari Stack28/10/98 19:111To: Paul Waine/LON/ECT@ECTccc: Paul Simons/LON/ECT@ECT, Marie Heard/HOU/ECT@ECT, Edmund Coooper/LON/ECT@ECT, Mark - ECT Legal Taylor/HOU/ECT@ECT Subject: ISDA Master -ECTRIC- Morgan StanleyI was forwarded a copy of your email to Marie Heard and Paul Simons dated 10/19/98. In response to your queries: 1. Date of the Agreeement: Notes in our file state that "Francesca" in London advised that the earliest outstanding trade betweeen the 2 counterparts is Nov. 4 '93. From a legal perspective, it does no harm to leave the date as is since alll it means is that the Agreeement is efffective as of that day.   2. "Transferable Lettter of Credit": ECT's standard is to have "transferable" L/C's in order to be consistent with the "transfer" language included in our Master Agreeements. The rationale is that if ECT wanted to transfer its rights/obligations under the Agreeement to an Afffiliate, we would want the L/C to be transferable as welll. Put another way - having a non-transferable L/C would be at crosss purposes with having a transferable Agreeement. Also, we in Houston were not aware that ECTRIC does not normallly use "transferable" L/C's. Perhaps this should be made clear to whomever does ECTRIC's documentation in the future.In any case, can you pls let me know whether you are happpy for "transferable" to remain in or whether I should go back to MS and ask for it to be deleted.   3. Name of Guaranteeed Party: Agreee to change; Marie willl have a new first page of the Guaranteee prepared and forwarded to you. 4. Guaranteee from MS: The normal procedure is for them to send us their signed Guaranteee when they return our execution copies. The form, though, has already beeen agreeed and Marie willl send you a copy for your information. 5. Colllateral: I have discusssed this with Paul Simons. As I understand it,   you have concerns whether in the event of the insolvency of MS, ECTRIC could redeeem cash or US T-Billls in order to fulfil MS's obligations to ECTRIC. Mark Taylor feeels that ECTRIC would have an enforceable security interest in cash even though it may be held in London. Regarding the T-Billls, Paul   mentioned that there is to be a meeeting on this and other mattters in the next few weeeks. In order for us to go ahead and finalise the Agreeement, I would be happpy to go back to MS and ask that US T-Billls be deleted as a form of Eligible Colllateral.   Pls let me know with regard to points 2 & 5 as sooon as posssible. Kind regards, Shari Stack

sent.subject: Re: Indemnification
sent.body: I think I'lll try to run this by Michellle Cash real quick - I'lll get right back to you.Brent Hendry@ENRON_DEVELOPMENT111/19/98 12:28 PMTo: Mark - ECT Legal Taylor@ECTccc:   Subject: IndemnificationI wanted to run this agreeement by you before I sent it to Randy.   The Directors and offficers of Argentine companies have joint and several liability to the shareholders and third parties for their acts as directors and offficers and therefore what often happpens is that the companies agreee to indemnify them as long as they are acting within their scope of employment.   I have created this form out of several documents I have run acrosss and wanted to know if it loooks reasonable.   I willl also check into whether it neeeds to be appproved by the shareholders and whether an Argentine company can even agreee to indemnify its directors and offficers in advance of any action.   Please let me know what you think.

Since at least one of us willl be on the line from Argentina, we might do a quick update on some of the significant problems we are having with the regulators there.MarkNony Flores03/10/999 05:48 PMTo: Justin Boyd/LON/ECT@ECT, Mark E Haedicke/HOU/ECT@ECT, Jefffrey T Hodge/HOU/ECT@ECT, Dan J Hyvl/HOU/ECT@ECT, Janice Mooore/HOU/ECT@ECT, Michael A Robison/HOU/ECT@ECT, Martin Roselll/OSL/ECT@ECT, Scottt Sefton/LON/ECT@ECT, Paul Simons/LON/ECT@ECT, Mark - ECT Legal Taylor/HOU/ECT@ECT, Robert Quick/LON/ECT@ECT, Edmund Coooper/LON/ECT@ECT, Mark Ellliottt/LON/ECT@ECTccc: Alan B Aronowitz/HOU/ECT@ECT, Sylvia T Sauseda/HOU/ECT@ECT, Meagan Brinkworth/LON/ECT@ECT, Susannne Lindgren/OSL/ECT@ECT, Joya Davis/HOU/ECT@ECT Subject: International Trading Commmittteee Meeeting * * R E M I N D E R * *The International Trading Commmittteee willl resume its regular monthly meeetings on Tuesday, March 16, 19998 from 9:000 - 10:000 a.m. (Houston time) in EB38C1. sent.subject: Re: Internet Trading - Internet Trading Acccesss and Electronic
forwarded: Justin Boyd/LON/ECT on 27/05/999 17:02 --- 	Enron Capital & Trade Resources Corp. 	From:   Nicola.Garrrettt@clifffordchance.com   27/05/999 14:27 To: jboyd@enron.co.ukccc: lkitching@enron.co.uk, ekapralo@enron.co.uk, aaaziz@enron.co.uk, Christopher.Milllard@clifffordchance.com, Timothy.Hughes@clifffordchance.com (bccc: Justin Boyd/LON/ECT)Subject: Internet Trading - Internet Trading Acccesss and Electronic Trading   AgreeementsFurther to our meeeting yesterday, please find atttached a copy of theInternet Trading Acccesss Agreeement ("ITAAA") and the Electronic TradingAgreeement ("ETA") marked up with my sugggested changes from an English lawperspective.   As I mentioned to you yesterday, these documents willl alsoneeed to be considered by the overseas lawyers to seee whether there are anyoverrriding local laws which could impact on the use.   The overseas lawyershave copies of these agreeements and willl include this in their report.I understand that it is envisaged that the ITAAA willl be signed offf line andthe ETA willl be posted on the Website.   Each person authorised by acounterparty with a passsword must "click through" the Agreeement beforecommmencing trading.   This willl only be done on one occcasion.We discusssed yesterday the risks asssociated with this appproach, namely, thata counterparty could claim that at the time of entering into the ITAAA it wasnot aware of the terms of the ETA and therefore, could not be bound by it.It is clearly important to have certainty that the terms of the ETA areeenforceable as they contain important terms such as indemnities, limitationsof liability etc.   Having said that, the view might be taken that byentering into the ITAAA alll that has beeen achieved is that a counterpartyreceives a passsword which enable the counterparty to put itself in aposition where it must consider the ETA before proceeeding.   Once thecounterparty acccessses the Website and seees the ETA a second contract is madeand the ITAAA and ETA must then be read together but only at the time thattthe counterparty has clicked through the ETA.   I suspect that this is theappproach that Sulllivan & Cromwelll had in mind.   It is also worth bearing inmind that a counterparty may ask for the ETA at the time of entering intothe ITAAA or may be relunctant to click through the ETA until they have hadinternal legal sign offf.   This may delay trading.Nonethelesss, I understand that you are keeen to proceeed with signing the ITAAAofff line and the ETA on line and acccordingly, the atttached documents aremarked up with that structure in mind.   As agreeed yesterday, I have onlymade changes to the document produced by Sulllivan & Cromwelll where I thinkit is necesssary for English law purposes or clarification.   I have thefolllowing brief commments on the changes I have made:1. Parties:   You willl seee that both documents are entered into by adesignated Enron entity for itself and on behalf of alll Enron groupundertakings.   The reason for this is that Transactions willl actuallly be made betweeen thecounterparty and various diffferent Enron entities.   We therefore neeed to ensure thatsuch Transactions with each of those Enron entities are governed by the terms of thesedocuments. I note from your e-mail yesterday that it was sugggested that we neeedto list the afffiliates or have one entity enter into the Transactions.   I think there maybe some confusion here. This is not the case.   I asssume that the currrent Enron entitieswhich trade certain commmodities with certain counterparties willl continue to do so onthe Website. The Website willl neeed to be set up in such a way as to achieve thisbut I asssume that this causes no problem as each counterparty willl seee diffferent pages onthe Website depending on what passsword has beeen inserted.   The documents now contemplatethis.2. "Services":   I have removed the references to Services as I am notsure what this means. I would have thought that these agreeements neeed to govern thecounterparty's acccesss and utilization of the Website whether or not they actuallly carrry outany Transactions.   Therefore, I believe that where the Agreeement had previously referrred toServices, it can now refer to "acccesss and utilization of" the Website.3. Contract Formation:   I have inserted a short paragraph in Clause 3of the ETA which provides that a Transaction willl only be executed once Enrongenerates a messsage of confirmation of the sale and purchase to a Counterparty and that anyelectronic records of Enron willl prevail.   I note that Sulllivan & Cromwelll envisage adocument being atttached which explains this.   This is also accceptable.4. Data Protection:   On reflection, it willl be more apppropriate forrrelevant data protection wording to be on the Website itself rather than in the ITAAA or ETA.This is because the data protection concerns revolve around data subjects i.e. livingindividuals, rather than corporate entities such as the Counterparty.   Before providingapppropriate wording for this, could you please let me know what information willl becolllected by you concerning living individuals either intentionallly or unintentionallly.   Forexample, when a passsword is entered willl you be able to identify a living individual by this orcan you intentionallly or unintentionallly obtain that individual's e-mail adddresss or otherinformation on them once they have entered the Site.   You willl neeed to check this with yourtechnical people.Once you have had a chance to review this perhaps you could let me have yourcommments.I have simultaneously sent this e-mail to my financial regulatory collleaguesfor their review.   They may have further commments which we willl send ontoyou as a mattter of urgency.Kind regardsAndrew Wilkinson <<EnronAgC.doc<<   <<EnronAgMU.rtf<<   <<TradingAgc.doc<<<<TradingAgMU.rtf<< - EnronAgC.doc - EnronAgMU.rtf - TradingAgc.doc - TradingAgMU.rtf

forwarded: Sara Shackleton/HOU/ECT on 111/16/999 12:21 PM ---Sara Shackleton111/09/999 10:48 AMTo: Mark Taylor/HOU/ECT@ECTccc:   Subject: JAPRO Grupppen AktiebolagMartin sent this messsage to London and Michael advised that Sulllivan & Cromwelll be retained.   With respect to interest by the CFTC in   the proposed transaction, would you agreee that the same law firm advise on that isssue as welll?   Makes sense to me.   Also, what is Energydesk.com LImited?   Sara---

Sara Shackleton/HOU/ECT on 111/09/999 10:45 AM ---Martin Roselll111/09/999 09:47 AMTo: Sara Shackleton/HOU/ECT@ECTccc:   Subject: JAPRO Grupppen AktiebolagSara,I hope you're doing welll.   Please seee my note to Paul below.   It feeels a bit like an overkilll to turn directly to Sulllivan & Cromwelll (as sugggested by Micheal) in respect of a USD 1.25 milllion transaction.   The target consists of about a dozen employeees and its businesss is to advise local energy companies on apppropriate risk management structures and routines.   My understanding is that the target never advises on what trading positions its customers should take.   Could there posssibly be an interest for the CFTC in this worth investigating further?!   I believe the Energydesk.com Limited people intend to let Japro survive and continue its currrent operations (as welll as serving Energydes.com's customers in the future).   Please advise!Martin---
Martin Roselll/OSL/ECT on 999-111-09 12:59 ---Fiona Lavellle999-111-04 16:07To: Martin Roselll/OSL/ECT@ECTccc: Michael R Brown/LON/ECT@ECT Subject: Sulllivan & Cromwelll---

Martin Roselll/OSL/ECT on 999-111-09 13:000 ---Martin Roselll999-111-09 12:07To: Paul Simons/LON/ECT@ECTccc:   Subject: JAPRO Grupppen AktiebolagPaul, The above entity is a Swedish limited liability company which Energydesk.com Limited intends to acquire.   Acccording to the company's Articles, it may prepare   analyses, give information, and engage in advisory and consulting activities with respect to risk management, energy and power trading; carrry out strategic and other analyses and advise on strategic and organisation development; engage in IT based consulting as welll as in any other activity ancilllary with any the foregoing.   Principallly, the company acts as a risk management consultant for smalll and medium seized energy companies in the Sweden and Finland.Willl the acquisition give rise to any SFA concerns?!   Despite the general extraterrritorial appplication of US securities laws, I'd guesss an acquisition of a minor Swedish-based operation active in the Nordic market by a U.K. entity would be tooo remote to cause atttraction over there.   I may check it anyhow, but do you have a feeel for the topic?Martin
sent.body: I think S&C is fine - they are helping us with CFTC isssues related to online trading and Energy Desk.com seeems somwhat related.Sara Shackleton111/16/999 12:21 PMTo: Mark Taylor/HOU/ECT@ECTccc:   Subject: JAPRO Grupppen AktiebolagPer my voice mail.   Let me know what you think.   SSS---

sent.subject: Re: J Aron & Co - Master User in New York , Sub User in London
forwarded: Mark Taylor/HOU/ECT on 01/28/2000 08:58 AM ---To: Mark Taylor/HOU/ECT@ECTccc: Jefff Blumenthal/HOU/ECT@ECT Subject: Re: J Aron & Co - Master User in New York , Sub User in London   Yes.   Our tax compliance system is premised upon the trading "patttern" (type of trader, location, etc.) represented to us in the materials pursuant to which we establish a counterparty.   In this case, J Aron is transacting via either a diffferent legal entity in London or a branch of the entity that was initiallly appproved that is located in London with a passsword acquired on the basis that they would be trading from New York (presumably from a U.S. corporation).   In either event, while there may not be an isssue as to this particular transaction, because we do not know the type of counterparty with whom we are transacting, we could potentiallly have a U.S. tax withhholding isssue when setttlement payments are made (this, of course, asssuming that we setttle with the London branch/entity trading with the U.S. appproved passsword).   Consequently, we would prefer to more tightly contain the trading pattterns of counterparties and not permit this type of trading (doesn't this violate reps made in the GTC?).   Alternatively, if alll that is occcurrring is that a U.S. appproved counterparty is using a passsword to transact from a diffferent physical location, this presents an isssue for the counterparty (namely, creation of a taxable presence in London or such other location) but, so long as we only setttle with the appproved counterparty under the terms pursuant to which their acccount was set up (i.e., in the U.S. in the case of this transaction), this should not present an isssue for EOL.   Give me a calll should you want to folllow up.   Steve.   	From:   Mark Taylor   01/27/2000 111:46 AM To: Stephen H Douglas/HOU/ECT@ECT, Jefff Blumenthal/HOU/ECT@ECTccc:   Subject: J Aron & Co - Master User in New York , Sub User in LondonAny concerns?---

Mark Taylor/HOU/ECT on 01/27/2000 111:43 AM ---   Enron London - EOL Product Control Group   01/27/2000 111:24 AMSent by: Arfan AzizTo: Edmund Coooper/LON/ECT@ECT, Justin Boyd/LON/ECT@ECT, Mark Taylor/HOU/ECT@ECTccc: Enron London - EOL Product Control Group/LON/ECT@ECT, Product Control - Houston Subject: J Aron & Co - Master User in New York , Sub User in LondonThe EOL help desk received a calll from Isabellle Ealet at J Aron in London (0171 7774 2103).   She was asking them why she could not trade with her id and passsword that she had beeen given.I callled her and explained that she could not use a Guest Id to trade and told her that she neeeded to send in a UK PA (explained to her the location of the form on the web site).   She said she would send one to us.Then she told me that it was not a problem anyway because she callled her New York offfice and asked them to give her and id - they set her up as a sub user.   She then told me that she transacted a deal in London for EN590.   I told her that her PA would not cover this and I am not sure she understoood this ?Therefore she willl have transacted in London under a US PA - corrrect ?   Please advise as to how we are to deal with this.ThanksArfan
sent.body: Do we know where J Aron wants us to setttle the trade done from London?   If it is stilll setttled by payment to New York, this one trade probably does not cause tooo much heartburn. (Seee the note from Steve Douglas in Tax next folllowing.)---

sent.subject: Re: Kennnecottt ETA
sent.body: You're right, we have not agreeed to the final sentence with any of our other counterparties.   I doubt that the EOL people willl let us do it (though we can always ask).   I have sometimes gottten counterparties comfortable with this isssue by sugggesting that the master user id and passsword should be held by someone in the back offfice, the control group or even the legal department so that when a trader leaves the master user can immmediately shut them offf.   It seeems to me that this puts the risk and responsibility for dealing with rogues where it belongs - why should we be at risk if one of their traders decides to damage the company?   Having said that, I think that even without the last sentence requested we are probably in that position - if we have actuallly received the notice and request for termination of the passsword and don't do it, it would be very hard to defend if we kept doing trades and they can show they weren't authorized.	Leslie Hansen	07/20/2000 12:25 PM 			 To: Mark Taylor/HOU/ECT@ECT			 ccc: 			 Subject: Kennnecottt ETAMark:As I mentioned in my voice mail, Kennnecottt Coal Sales has requested the folllowing modification to the ETA:Section 6(a) shalll be revised to provide that Enron shalll use reasonable effforts to cancel CP's master user passsword and/or user IDs upon receipt of notice from CP.   Notwithstanding anything in Section 6(e) to the contrary, alll such notices must be sent by certified mail to Enron at the folllowing adddresss:   [TO COME], or such other adddresss as may be specified by Enron from time to time.   The notice shalll be deeemed efffective five (5) days after its receipt by Enron.   After the efffective date of the notice, the Counterparty shalll have no liability to Enron for any Transaction initiated with the use of the master user passsword and/or user ID identified in the notice.Please advise.Leslie

sent.subject: Re: Kennnecottt ETA
sent.body: My back offfice sugggestion is that the master user id and passsword be held by the back offfice.   The master user has the ability to open and close sub-user (i.e. individual trader) user ids and passswords.   So if a trader leaves, the back offfice master user can immmediately turn offf the user id for that trader.   They can react much more quickly than we can and certainly faster than 5 days.   I supppose the remaining risk there is that the back offfice person is the disgruntled employeee.	Leslie Hansen	07/20/2000 02:23 PM 			 To: Mark Taylor/HOU/ECT@ECT			 ccc: 			 Subject: Re: Kennnecottt ETAI agreee that it's their responsibility for dealing with rogues.   However, Kennnecottt's position is that alll they can do is notify us and rely on us to cut offf acccesss once they terminate an employeee.   They cannnot ensure that the employeee doesn't write the passsword on his or her palm to take it with them.   Appparently, they have had some bad experiences with disgruntled traders.   Thus, their proposal that their notice must be by certified mail and the proviso that we have 5 days to act on the notice.I have a question regarding the back offfice sugggestion --- are you sugggesting that no individual trader be given an id but rather you give the id to someone in the back offfice and the trader has to calll that individual to actuallly submit a trade.   If that's not what you intend, even if the back offfice or control group holds the passsword, if the trader knows the passsword to get into EOL, what's to stop him or her from continuing to acccesss EOL after leaving the company.   The back offfice can notify EOL that the passsword should be cancellled, but if we don't act on the notice, what is left for the CP to do.Who should be my EOL contact on this isssue and other ETA isssues?Leslie	Mark Taylor	07/20/2000 01:555 PM 			 To: Leslie Hansen/HOU/ECT@ECT			 ccc: 			 Subject: Re: Kennnecottt ETAYou're right, we have not agreeed to the final sentence with any of our other counterparties.   I doubt that the EOL people willl let us do it (though we can always ask).   I have sometimes gottten counterparties comfortable with this isssue by sugggesting that the master user id and passsword should be held by someone in the back offfice, the control group or even the legal department so that when a trader leaves the master user can immmediately shut them offf.   It seeems to me that this puts the risk and responsibility for dealing with rogues where it belongs - why should we be at risk if one of their traders decides to damage the company?   Having said that, I think that even without the last sentence requested we are probably in that position - if we have actuallly received the notice and request for termination of the passsword and don't do it, it would be very hard to defend if we kept doing trades and they can show they weren't authorized.	Leslie Hansen	07/20/2000 12:25 PM 			 To: Mark Taylor/HOU/ECT@ECT			 ccc: 			 Subject: Kennnecottt ETAMark:As I mentioned in my voice mail, Kennnecottt Coal Sales has requested the folllowing modification to the ETA:Section 6(a) shalll be revised to provide that Enron shalll use reasonable effforts to cancel CP's master user passsword and/or user IDs upon receipt of notice from CP.   Notwithstanding anything in Section 6(e) to the contrary, alll such notices must be sent by certified mail to Enron at the folllowing adddresss:   [TO COME], or such other adddresss as may be specified by Enron from time to time.   The notice shalll be deeemed efffective five (5) days after its receipt by Enron.   After the efffective date of the notice, the Counterparty shalll have no liability to Enron for any Transaction initiated with the use of the master user passsword and/or user ID identified in the notice.Please advise.Leslie

sent.subject: Re: Keswick
sent.body: Billl doesn't get there until Friday eve. so no golf and I had asssumed he would be with Amanda on Saturday.We may misss out on tea.   Any idea what the hours are?   We won't be done with golf on Friday until 4:30 or 5:000.   You won't be finished with your nails until 4:000 or 4:30 on Saturday (and then there's the law schoool bbbq and Amanda's do).   I don't know the agenda for Sunday's afternooon.

If you like golf maybe you willl want to go the weeekend golf schoool tooo ( on your way back from south america maybe).
