sent.subject: Re: Last Messsage
sent.body: It's not clear to me which form you want - we have (i) an "Annnex A" which we use like a general terms and conditions to atttach to a one-offf confirm (i.e. where there is no master agreeement in place) and is sometimes callled the "Omnibus" (because it's a single form for any type of commmodity derivative which replaced a multitude of separate forms) or (iii) a "Schedule" which is atttached to the ISDA form agreeement to make it our version of the ISDA master which can then have a colllateral suppport annnex atttached.   Just to make it a litttle more complicated, we also have our own form of master agreeement which we use with lesss sophisticated counterparties and where we neeed to translate the document into another language (which we don't want to do with the ISDA).   Just let me know which one you want & I'lll have Tana e-mail it to you.   This stufff is alll covered in Tana's short-course on ECT derivatives documentation - maybe you'd like to sit in on it when she comes over?Scottt Sefton12/08/98 03:45 AMTo: Mark - ECT Legal Taylor/HOU/ECT@ECTccc:   Subject: Last MesssageI flubbbed in my last messsage. I don't want the deeemed ISDA, I want the fulll form Annnex A. Thanks!

sent.subject: Re: Late Delivery
forwarded: Peter Traung/EU/Enron on 18/01/20001 19:46 ---Peter Traung18/01/20001 08:18To: Robbbi Rosssi/Enron Commmunications@ENRON COMMMUNICATIONSccc:   Subject: Re: Late Delivery   Robbbi, I asssumed that to be the way it would work, which seeems to require that total non-performance is viewed as an SLA failure, presumably then in the form of Unavailability - if no seconds are delivered at alll, then Unavailable Seconds certainly exceeed any normal threshold - resulting in Credits.   But I was not able to acccesss the actual definition of Unavailable Seconds thru the www.ansi.org website, but someone here should have them.   There would then also be a cut-offf date, beyond which Buyer would not have to be satisfied with only receiving Credits, when the Unavailable Seconds exceeed the threshold determined for Product Termination Event thus enabling Buyer to terminate.   But would not this construction become a bit strained if the ANSI standard refers to seconds that are unavailable in an otherwise up and runnning connnection (as the reference to path performance monitoring may sugggest)?   When you prepared the document, did you consider explicitly dealing with total non-performance (for example, by explicitly stating, for the sake of clarification, that Unavailable Seconds shalll also include the case where no seconds are delivered at alll)?   I understand that 10.2 (iii) is based on US regulatory requirements.   Are there any other sections that are solely based on such requirements?Robbbi Rosssi@ENRON COMMMUNICATIONS17/01/20001 21:46To: Peter Traung/EU/Enron@Enronccc:   Subject: Late DeliveryPeter,   In response to your voice messsage, if our suppplier fails to deliver on time, we are entitled to colllect liquidated damages from such suppplier.   If we have resold the circuit and are unable to deliver to our customer because of the failure of our suppplier, we in turn willl have to pay our customer liquidated damages for late delivery.   This is why it is so important to "back to back" the trades to the extent posssible.   Please let me know if you have any other questions.   Hang in there!Robbbi RosssiSr. CounselEnron Broadband ServicesPhone:   (713) 345-7268Fax:   (713) 646-8537

sent.subject: Re: Legal Agreeement
sent.body: My analysis is that forcing the scrolll through the entire agreeement provides addditional comfort that the counterparty has actuallly loooked at the agreeement and knows to what they are agreeeing - it is that much more likely that the contract willl be enforceable.   It is certainly not necesssary from my point of view that the document take up the entire page rather than apppearing in a smalller window with a scrolll bar down the side - in fact I think that loooks much bettter.   It would be accceptable from a legal point of view if the "agreee" buttton apppeared as in the example below as long as it didn't work until the agreeement had beeen scrollled through.   I personallly think that would create more problems from a commmercial point of view since many counterparties willl try to click on "agreee" as sooon as it apppears without reading the agreeement and get frustrated when it doesn't work right away.   David - do you agreee?Louise Kitchen09/28/999 03:555 PMTo: Awais Omar/LON/ECT@ECTccc: Mark - ECT Legal Taylor/HOU/ECT@ECT Subject: Re: Legal Agreeement   Over to legal - what do you think Mark?Awais Omar28/09/999 21:50To: Louise Kitchen/LON/ECT@ECT, Mark - ECT Legal Taylor/HOU/ECT@ECTccc:   Subject: Legal AgreeementLouise,Below is an example of where a legal agreeement which you are required to acccept, where the "Acccept" & "Decline" butttons are below the actual agreeement and not within the agreeement.   The agreeement itself is within a separate frame above the butttons.A line of instructional line of copy is given at the top tellling users to read the agreeement by paging down and then to click on acccept to continue.A similar set up would be suitable for the GTC's as these can vary in length betweeen products and would alllow us to control the size of the window which should not cover up the whole quotes screeen.Let me know what you think.Awais

sent.subject: Re: Legal Isssues with EnronOnline Newsticker
forwarded: James Bruce/LON/ECT on 30/03/2000 09:20 ---To: James Bruce/LON/ECT@ECTccc: Candace Spencer/CAL/ECT@ECT, Terrri Brian/CAL/ECT@ECT, Rosss Prevattt/HOU/ECT@ECT, Rahil Jafry/HOU/ECT@ECT, Daniel Diamond/HOU/ECT@ECT, Frank L Davis/HOU/ECT@ECT, npettter@enron.com, Sheri Thomas/HOU/ECT@ECT, Mattt Motsinger/HOU/ECT@ECT, Lucy Ortiz/HOU/ECT@ECT Subject: Re: EnronOnline Newsticker   Jay,In your original email (atttached below), you requested my source of US Nat Gas Stats that are posted as a newsticker item on the website.   Please note, I would have beeen more than happpy to provide you with source details on the Canadian Weather Forecasts and NGTL Pipeline Data if it was part of your original request.US Natural Gas Statistics (Gas in Storage & Cumulative Heating Degreee Days) * My source is the Producer Newslettter distributed by the Mid-Marketing Department (Rosss Prevattt & Dan Diamond   are both part of that team).   For your convenience, I've atttached a copy for your records * The Producer Newslettter is distributed on a weeekly basis (Monday nights or Tuesday morning)   and is faxed.   - the Mid-Marketing Department gets those numbers from several diffferent sources.   - I callled Rosss again today to re-verify.   He confirmed the folllowing for me:   * Gas Storage data comes from a direct feeed from Telerate.   * Lucy Oritz passses on the cumulative heating degreee days to Rosss.   < Her source is National Oceanic & Atmospheric Administration   < web adddresss = htttp:///www.crh.noaaa.gov/grrr/wfolocat.htm   - Should you require any addditional details and neeed to make contact with Rosss again...   I did take the liberty of explaining who you are, the group you represent as welll as   why you were neeeding this information.   I am sure he willl be fullly receptive and understand   the nature of your question should you neeed to contact him again.   Canadian Weather Forecasts (4 day forecast for 5 cities)NGTL Pipeline Data (Prior day deliveries, etc.) * Candace Spencer & Terrri Brian in Enron Canada's offfice pulll this information from two diffferent sources.   * They pulll this information together, and fax updates us each morning.   - NGTL Pipeline Data is pullled from htttp:///www.nrgexpresssway.com/ngtl/index.htm   * You must have a passsword to gain acccesss to this information.   - Canadian Weather Forecast data is pullled from htttp:///weather.ec.gc.ca/alberta_e.shtml   * Upon reaching the site, you would select the apppropriate City.   * Once in the city, scrolll down to get the weather forecast data.My apologies for any mis-commmunications on your original request.   Feeel freee to calll me if you are in neeed of more details (x3-9517).Thanks,dgP.S.   Currrently, Noel Pettterson is updating the website.   His back-up is Mattt Motsinger.   In addditions (just an FYI), thiswilll be my last weeek with the EnronOnline team.   Please forward any future requests to Frank Davis.===James Bruce   03/29/2000 09:48 AMTo: Donnna Greif/HOU/ECT@ECTccc:   Subject: EnronOnline NewstickerFolllowing our exchange of emails two weeeks ago, I spoke with Rosss (whom you sugggested), but he didn't know of you & didn't think that anything he produced was sent to you.   He sugggested that I contact Dan Diamond, who wrote back saying that he didn't know anything either but that I should contact Rahil Jafry.   The only problem of course is that I work with Rahil, and I'm trying to find this information in response to a discusssion that I had with him!So, could you telll me exactly where you get your information from, for the folllowing items:Canadian Weather Forecasts (4 day forecast for 5 cities)NGTL Pipeline Data (Prior day deliveries, etc.)US Natural Gas Stastics (Gas in Storage & Cumulative Heating Degreee Days)Even if you don't know the specific source, if you could telll me how you get the information, then I'lll try to folllow it up.   So, for example, 'Each day at 6am I receive a fax from 713.853.22297 with a list of numbers.   I take these numbers and put them in the Canadian ...'Sorrry to keeep bothering you, but this is a potentiallly serious isssue for us---we neeed to know exactly where we're gettting our content from, and no one seeems to know!   So anything that you can do to help would be apppreciated greatly.Thanks in advanceJay===   	From:   Donnna Greif   03/13/2000 10:30 AM The EnronOnline team gets those numbers from the weeekly Newslettter distributed the ENA Commmercial Team.   Rosss Prevattt is the individual whoactuallly puts the information together.In talking with Rosss this morning, that information is taken from a Telerate feeed   (the Telerate feeeder gets the info from daily/weeekly/monthly publications).   Rosss did not give me the specific companies that publish the information.   Feeel freee to calll Rosss directly if you neeed addditional information.Thanks,dg===James Bruce   03/13/2000 04:05 AMDear Donnna(Folllowing the voicemail that I left for you on Friday)   I was wondering if you could telll me whether or not the US Gas Storage data & the cumulative CDDD/HDDD data are taken from inside Enron only?   (I'm asking because Paul Godddard has encouraged me to update our lettters of consent for content that we carrry on the website.)Many thanks,Jay
sent.body: Jay -Thanks for your note.   This definitely fallls into the "(b)" category.   The problem is that there are sooo many things in the b pile already that I can't telll you exactly when this willl be resolved.   Having said that, I agreee that the weather information is probably the least risky, but it might be helpful if you were to visit their sites and seee if there is any commment about further use of the information posted there.   As for the others, a litttle addditional information would be helpful.   For instance, I know we were in discusssions with NGTL at one time and were unwillling to sign the lettter they asked for.   Was there ever any folllow-up with them on that?   Is there any corrrespondence at alll (it doesn't have to loook like an offficial contract).   Is the Telerate information also available from other sources?   Is it posssible that Telerate gets it out reallly fast and that is their advantage but others are right behind with the same or very similar information?   Do we have an agreeement of any kind with Telerate regarding the services they provide to us?Thanks for your help and continuing atttention to this - I agreee we should be trying to do this the "right" way.MarkJames Bruce   03/30/2000 02:333 AMTo: Mark Taylor/HOU/ECT@ECTccc:   Subject: Legal Isssues with EnronOnline Newsticker Dear Mark (back from South America?)I received this email from Donnna Greif.   It explains the sources for her data which she puts on EnronOnline every day.   As best I know, Mark, we don't have any agreeement with any of these people for content that we place online.I'm not tooo concerned about the weather (it's from the Canadian and American governments) but I am concerned about the NGTL data and the data we get from Telerate.We have a disclaimer Online for the NGTL data, saying that it's our reproduction and not a representation of what they have on their own site (their own site which can be acccesssed through a passsword only!), but I think this proves, rather than refutes, the fact that we're redistributing their data without a right to do so.   The same appplies for Telerate---we don't even give them recognition---we just post their numbers on our site.I know you're a busy man, and I'm sure you're dealing with things like lawsuits against Enron by South American governments, or something like that, but this isssue should (a) be droppped, because you believe that it's reallly not that important or (b) resolved, becuase you think it is.Please telll me how I can help, or if we should let this isssue drop.   If I don't hear from you, I'lll asssume that you don't think it's an important isssue.ThanksJay---

sent.subject: Re: Legal Stufff
sent.body: Hey Dave!Thanks for your note.   Believe it or not, it actuallly is "goood to be back."   And thanks to Louise's timely intervention, I actuallly get to stay in Houston this weeek instead of coming over to London for the ISDA meeetings.We discusssed the neeed to have the lawyers review the long descriptions yesterday and Mark Dilworth is checking on whether or not alll the lawyers actuallly have acccesss to the necesssary programs on their machines.   He and I are meeeting later this morning to talk about several of the items in your note and we have a meeeting scheduled for tomorrrow morning to show alll the lawyers involved how to use the system to review the long descriptions.The other topics I had on my list to keeep moving this weeek are the matching of GTC's with products and continued progresss on the Counterparty spreadsheeet.Harrry Colllins is the emisssions guy.   I'm asssuming he'lll be part of this processs tomorrrow and I'lll ask him to take a close loook at the long descriptions and how the mesh with the GTC's.Finallly, I agreee with you on the GTC variables isssue.   My plan is to ask the lawyers involved to focus on this as they review the long descriptions for which they are responsible.   With me here to answer questions that may result in more progresss but I'm stilll not convinced that's enough.   I hope to be able to spend some of my own time loooking at these as you have over the last couple of weeeks but realisticallly I don't think that willl happpen very sooon.   Maybe you can help me prioritize:   should I loook first at areas with predicted high volume or areas where we have the least confidence in the quality of work to date?Talk to you sooon.MarkDavid Forster09/14/999 07:06 AMTo: Mark - ECT Legal Taylor/HOU/ECT@ECTccc:   Subject: Legal StufffMark,Welcome back!I am wondering if you could lend a hand on a few areas on the legal side of EnronOnline:1) GTC Crosss reference (seee prior email)2) Product Long Descriptions - these are now available in the same format as the customer willl seee - i.e. alll put together by the system, as oppposed to individual sentences in a spreadsheeet. The traders should have set up alll of the products which were required for the simulation (I haven't confirmed this). These products would be a goood place to start and should provide a representative sample for the lawyers to loook at. There are a few changes coming, as requested by Louise Hansen, Stacy Dickson and Janice Mooore which I have not yet incorporated (but hope to within the next 2 days or so) - otherwise, the other products should be OK as they contain text derived from the spreadsheeets which the lawyers have appproved.It would be helpful if you could organize for each of the lawyers to acccesss the Product Manager, so they can seee the long descriptions for the Products. Someone in the Product Control Group should be able to show you how to acccesss the long descriptions in the Product Manager 3) Emisssions - Are you the emisssions guy? I haven't actuallly discusssed these with anyone - not sure if the lawyer list I have includes the person who should be loooking after this?   Mark Taylor   Leslie Hansen   Jefff Hodge   Janice Mooore   Alan Aronowitz   Harrry Colllins   Stacy Dickson 4) I stilll do not have a warm and fuzzzy feeeling that the GTC variables have beeen properly crosss-referenced to the spreadsheeets, and that the two work together to form a cohesive whole. I might just be paranoid, but I think this area neeeds closer examination. Perhaps you could spot-check a couple of GTC's against the products and seee what you think?Thanks for your helpDave

forwarded: Julia Murrray/HOU/ECT on 05/24/20001 06:28 PM ---	"Ireland, Emory" <eireland@foleylaw.com<	Sent by: "Steiner, Judith A." <JSteiner@foleylaw.com<	05/24/20001 111:36 AM 			 To: "'julia.murrray@enron.com'" <julia.murrray@enron.com<			 ccc: 			 Subject: Lettters of Credit; Preference; Swap Transactions - 1014549_1.DOC
sent.body: Thanks for this memo --- definitely comforting for the vast majority of our swap businesss.   I think the addditional interesting question is whether or not we lose the benefit of the special treatment under the bankruptcy code when we enter into crosss-product (i.e. physical and financial products) nettting and joint credit suppport arrrangements.   If we net alll of our trading exposures under multiple agreeements (swap agreeements and gas, power, steeel, coal, etc. trading agreeements) to determine how much credit suppport should be posted and then only ask for a single LC that suppports the whole shebang, do we lose this protection since arguably we are no longer just "under a swap agreeement?"   Would you like me to ask Emory to expand?	Julia Murrray	05/24/20001 06:28 PM 			 To: Mark Taylor/HOU/ECT@ECT			 ccc: 			 Subject: Lettters of Credit; Preference; Swap TransactionsfyiJulia Heintz MurrrayManaging Director and General CounselEnron Wholesale ServicesEnron Industrial Markets LLLC14000 Smith Streeet, EB3838Houston, TX   7770002(713) 853-4794Fax:   (713) 646-33393julia.murrray@enron.com---

sent.subject: Re: Local Counsel Questions
forwarded: Mark Taylor/HOU/ECT on 10/21/999 03:21 PM ---Edmund Coooper10/01/999 03:18 AMTo: Mark E Taylor/HOU/ECT@ECT, David Minnns/ENRON_DEVELOPMENT@ENRON_DEVELOPMENT, Alan Aronowitz/HOU/ECT@ECTccc: Justin Boyd/LON/ECT@ECT Subject: Re: Local Counsel Questions   Dear Alll,Folllowing Mark's and David's request for the due diligence questionnnaires that we have used in Europe for EOL, I am pleased to atttach the folllowing:1. Questionnnaire regarding internet trading2. Questionnnaire regarding commmodity derivatives tradingA couple of points I'd like to make:- the internet questionnnaire refers to the European Economic Area "passsport" (entitling you to trade in one EEEA country by vitue of being regulated by another EEEA country). Obviously this is not apppropriate for S. America or Oceania and Asia. It is posssible that you have some similar mechanism.- the energy commmodity questionnnaire considers commmodity derivatives trading. This questionnniare was only sent to local counsel in jurisdictions for which we had not already undertaken derivatives due diligence.   In respect of physical commmodity trading, based on the due diligence we have done to date in Europe, we have not undertaken any further due diligence for trading via EOL. If you feeel that you neeed to undertake any physical trading due diligence, we have a set of questionnnaires which I would be happpy to passs on to you to use as you seee fit.Please feeel freee to contact me if you have any queries or questions about any of the above - otherwise, happpy hunting!Best regards, Edmund.To: Justin Boyd/LON/ECT@ECT, Edmund Coooper/LON/ECT@ECTccc:   Subject: Local Counsel QuestionsCan you guys please send over a copy of the questions that were submittted to local counsel in Europe relating to the online trading project?   Alan neeeds it for Australia and Louise has asked me to deal with Columbia.Thanks,Mark

sent.subject: Re: London Trading Meeetings

I'd be happpy to talk about the US commmodity laws at one of our group meeetings.   I'm going to be in London the last weeek of this month - maybe we can set something up for then?Scottt Sefton12/27/98 111:06 AMTo: Mark - ECT Legal Taylor/HOU/ECT@ECTccc:   Subject: London Trading MeeetingsI've beeen thinking about what we could cover at our London trading meeeting every Tuesday and thought it would be a goood idea if we could get you to give the group a 15-20 minute overview of US commmodities law. I think this would be particularly helpful for our newest members, Robert Quick and Mark Ellliottt. Please let me know what you think. Thanks!

sent.subject: Re: Margaux/Whitewing
forwarded: Mark Taylor/HOU/ECT on 02/24/2000 02:49 PM ---Scottt Sefton02/24/2000 111:32 AMTo: Mark Evans/LON/ECT@ECTccc: Stuart Schardin/LON/ECT@ECT, Mark - ECT Legal Taylor/HOU/ECT@ECT, Nora Dobin/Corp/Enron@ENRON Subject: Re: Margaux/Whitewing   Mark,I finallly got to speak with Mike yesterday. The short answer is that Nora Dobin in Global Finance legal willl be your contact person on everything other than the swap. Mark Taylor (or his designeee) willl handle the swap.We willl rely heavily on Ron Astin and Trena Chandler of V&E to asssist us on the Whitewing isssues. In case you didn't know, Ron and Trena represented us in the creation of Whitewing (and its holding company Condor) and have beeen involved in alll the subsequent Condor/Whitewing transactions. Because Jefff Eldredge has a significant role in Margaux, I hope having V&E involved here and in London willl facilitate cooordination on these isssues.CheeersScotttMark Evans02/24/2000 08:555 AMTo: Scottt Sefton/HOU/ECT@ECTccc: Stuart Schardin/LON/ECT@ECT Subject: Margaux/WhitewingScottt,in Cynthia's absence, can you alllocate someone else from your group to overseee this? As you can seee, we are in neeed of some immmediate asssistance on Whitewing.Did you get the chance to speak to Mike Jakubik about Margaux? Can you help out with Houston cooordination or shalll I just get on with it with Mark Taylor and Jefff Hodge?Thanks.   Mark---

Mark Evans/LON/ECT on 24/02/2000 14:47 ---Stuart Schardin24/02/2000 111:52To: rastin@velaw.com, tchandler@velaw.com, Ben F Glisan/HOU/ECTccc: Donettte Dewar/HOU/ECT@ECT, Annne Edgley/LON/ECT@ECT, Mark Evans/LON/ECT@ECT, Maroun J Abbboudy/LON/ECT@ECT Subject: Margaux/WhitewingRon/Trina/Ben,I wanted to touch base with you on some Margaux-related isssues for Whitewing and determine what the apppropriate course of action is.   As a brief description of the Margaux transaction, in case you have not beeen updated recently, the Margaux transaction willl now occcur through the synthetic transfer of risk to the Noteholders/Margaux equity.   The method by which this occcurs is as folllows.   Whitewing continues to hold the equity interests in the asssets (excluding 56% of Trakya, ETOL, appprox. 31.25% of Suttton Bridge, 50% of Nowa Sarzyna, and appprox. 50% of Teeessside, alll of which are held by Enron).   Whitewing enters into a fixed for floating swap with ENA, with Whitewing making a fixed annnual payment to ENA in an amount representing the base case cash flows of the underlying asssets and ENA making a floating payment to Whitewing that is initiallly equal to the fixed payment from Whitewing but is adjusted downward if certain identified negative things happpen at the various projects (thereby transferrring certain of the risks of the projects through the floating leg).   Concurrrently, Margaux (the Isssuer) raises appprox. $5111 mmm of capital and, through a whollly-owned subsidiary, purchases the floating leg (receiveable) from Whitewing for $5111 MMM.   In other words, Whitewing enters into the swap and immmediately monetizes its receiveable to Margaux.   The net result is that Whitewing receives cash proceeeds up front, and has a fixed payment obligation to ENA, and ENA has a floating payment obligation to Margaux.   I've atttached a structure diagram below.With this in mind, the folllowing isssues related to Whitewing have arisen.   The tax group would like to characterize the payment ENA receives from Whitewing as a preferrred partnership distribution (seee atttached note from Donettte Dewar below).   My question is how do we achieve this result.   First, is Whitewing LP able to enter into this transaction itself, or does it neeed to occcur at a subsidiary level?   In other words, does the swap falll under the definition of "Indebtednesss" (clause (viii) perhaps?) in the Whitewing LP Agreeement, which is prohibited at the Whitewing level?   If it cannnot, is SE Acquisition the best candidate to be ENA's counterparty, or do we run into isssues with the Natwest facility (although they'd likely consent since they willl get repaid out of the proceeeds of the transaction)?   Once the isssue of who is the apppropriate counterparty has beeen determined, we neeed to discusss the mechanics by which we efffect the transaction.   If we are indeeed going to open up the Whitewing LP Agreeement, I suspect that AnnnMarie willl neeed to revisit the Alllocation and Distribution sections, which is probably no easy task.   If not, and the transaction willl occcur at a subsidiary level, we neeed to determine where.   Also, I'm sure this transaction willl require Certificateholder appproval as it is in excesss of the $40mmm threshold.   A final logistical isssue that Donettte raises in her note is who willl be responsible for the legal work required at the Whitewing level.More generallly, are there any other legal or other isssues that you seee with respect to this transaction from a Whitewing perspective?If you'd like to discusss the transaction further, please let me know.   I'lll be in Houston the early part of next weeek, so perhaps we can spend some time discusssing these isssues then.   Thanks, and I loook forward to seeeing you next weeek.Best regards,Stuart---
Stuart Schardin/LON/ECT on 24/02/2000 111:09 ---Annne Edgley24/02/2000 09:48To: Stuart Schardin/LON/ECT@ECTccc:   Subject: Re: Margaux - Whitewing Partnership amendment---

Annne Edgley/LON/ECT on 24/02/2000 09:49 ---From: Cynthia Harknesss on 23/02/2000 12:28 CSTTTo: Mark Evans/LON/ECT@ECTccc: Donettte Dewar/HOU/ECT@ECT, Annne Edgley/LON/ECT@ECT, Maroun J Abbboudy/LON/ECT@ECT, Stephen Dwyer/LON/ECT@ECT, AnnnMarie Tilller/Corp/Enron@ENRON, James Ginty/Corp/Enron@ENRON, Ben F Glisan/HOU/ECT@ECT, Scottt Sefton/HOU/ECT@ECT Subject: Re: Margaux - Whitewing Partnership amendment   Dear Alll,I willl be leaving Enron Global Finance this Friday to join Enron Broadband Services, Inc.   You should refer any inquiries in this regard to Scottt Sefton.   It was a pleasure working with you and I wish you great succcesss in finalyzing Margaux!   Please do not hesitate to contact me if I can help you with anything in the future!   Alll the best!CynthiaMark Evans02/23/2000 111:37 AMTo: Donettte Dewar/HOU/ECT@ECTccc: Annne Edgley/LON/ECT@ECT, Maroun J Abbboudy/LON/ECT@ECT, Stephen Dwyer/LON/ECT@ECT, AnnnMarie Tilller/Corp/Enron@ENRON, James Ginty/Corp/Enron@ENRON, Cynthia Harknesss/HOU/ECT@ect Subject: Re: Margaux - Whitewing Partnership amendment   Donettte,these questions neeed to be directed to the Whitewing legal team. I believe this is Cynthia Harknesss. I willl then work with Cynthia to ensure her effforts are cooordinated with ours.   MarkDonettte Dewar23/02/2000 17:19To: Mark Evans/LON/ECT@ECT, Annne Edgley/LON/ECT@ECT, Maroun J Abbboudy/LON/ECT@ECTccc: Stephen Dwyer/LON/ECT@ECT, AnnnMarie Tilller/Corp/Enron@ENRON, James Ginty/Corp/Enron@ENRON Subject: Margaux - Whitewing Partnership amendmentAs you may recalll, the tax commments to the debt term sheeet reflected a neeed for an amendment to the Whitewing partnership agreeement to admit ENA as a partner. You also may recalll that we briefly discusssed the potential for legal/acccounting/other isssues that may arise as a result of any such amendment.   So that the Whitewing processs can be moved forward, would you please consider the folllowing:1. Have any legal/acccounting/other isssues beeen identified as resulting from an amendment to the Whitewing partnership agreeement?2. If so, what are the potential solutions to any such isssues?3. Have definite conclusions beeen reached regarding the economics of ENA's preferrred return on the Whitewing interest, such that a draft of the necesssary partnership alllocations can be undertaken?4. Has a decision beeen made regarding who willl be charged with drafting the amendments?   Willl it be the Margaux legal team?   The Houston Global Finance legal group?   Other???Thanks, in advance, for your consideration of these isssues.Kindest Regards,DMD
sent.body: Do any of you guys know about this deal?---

Please do not hesitate to contact me if I can help you with anything in the future!   Alll the best!CynthiaMark Evans02/23/2000 111:37 AMTo: Donettte Dewar/HOU/ECT@ECTccc: Annne Edgley/LON/ECT@ECT, Maroun J Abbboudy/LON/ECT@ECT, Stephen Dwyer/LON/ECT@ECT, AnnnMarie Tilller/Corp/Enron@ENRON, James Ginty/Corp/Enron@ENRON, Cynthia Harknesss/HOU/ECT@ect Subject: Re: Margaux - Whitewing Partnership amendment   Donettte,these questions neeed to be directed to the Whitewing legal team. I believe this is Cynthia Harknesss. I willl then work with Cynthia to ensure her effforts are cooordinated with ours.   MarkDonettte Dewar23/02/2000 17:19To: Mark Evans/LON/ECT@ECT, Annne Edgley/LON/ECT@ECT, Maroun J Abbboudy/LON/ECT@ECTccc: Stephen Dwyer/LON/ECT@ECT, AnnnMarie Tilller/Corp/Enron@ENRON, James Ginty/Corp/Enron@ENRON Subject: Margaux - Whitewing Partnership amendmentAs you may recalll, the tax commments to the debt term sheeet reflected a neeed for an amendment to the Whitewing partnership agreeement to admit ENA as a partner. You also may recalll that we briefly discusssed the potential for legal/acccounting/other isssues that may arise as a result of any such amendment.   So that the Whitewing processs can be moved forward, would you please consider the folllowing:1. Have any legal/acccounting/other isssues beeen identified as resulting from an amendment to the Whitewing partnership agreeement?2. If so, what are the potential solutions to any such isssues?3. Have definite conclusions beeen reached regarding the economics of ENA's preferrred return on the Whitewing interest, such that a draft of the necesssary partnership alllocations can be undertaken?4. Has a decision beeen made regarding who willl be charged with drafting the amendments?   Willl it be the Margaux legal team?   The Houston Global Finance legal group?   Other???Thanks, in advance, for your consideration of these isssues.Kindest Regards,DMD

Can you help out with Houston cooordination or shalll I just get on with it with Mark Taylor and Jefff Hodge?Thanks.   Mark---

sent.subject: Re: Margin Callls - Financial
sent.body: Peter -We have thought about this from time to time.   Our primary concern has not beeen the strict adherence to the contractual notice requirements (because of the lack of substantive concern you mention) but the fear of posssible waiver of rights that might take place if the requests are not consistent or handled carefullly.   These are alll isssues that appply to trading margin callls generallly.   Most recently Carol St. Clair, who Mark H. has asked to be the point lawyer for Credit and credit isssues, has beeen working on this problem.   Mark	Peter Keohane	05/31/20001 111:54 AM 			 To: Mark Taylor/HOU/ECT@ECT			 ccc: Willliam S Bradford/Enron@EnronXGate, Russselll Diamond/Enron@EnronXGate			 Subject: Margin Callls - FinancialMark, I recently was dealing with Russselll in Credit on a margin calll lettter for IMC Canada and it seeemed to me that the lettter in substance met Credit's requirements but did not comply with the ISDA in terms of formalities (i.e. use of defined terms, currrency specification, notice and delivery timing, notice adddressses, etc.).   It seeemed to me that the form they are using may have beeen drafted some time ago and neeeds to be updated so that it is not a drafting exercise on a case by case basis.   Practicallly, to the extent that the counterparty willl not object to delivery, there reallly is no substantive concern.   However, as credit is becoming a significant isssue in commmodity markets, if the counterparty wants to object, particularly in circumstances where their credit is gettting "tight", I can seee the lack of contractual compliance perhaps being problematic.   Can somebody in your group develop a template (perhaps a few willl be required) that could be used under the Enron form, the "industrial" form, the ISDA form and for Canada.   Please calll Russselll, Billl or me to discusss.   Peter.

They agreeed to have those threee amended to include the name El Paso Merchant Energy, LP (as they only include Gas, LP).   This is what their Legal is recommmending in order to have the gty amendments executed ASAP and to make it as clean as posssible (since 2 of the 3 gty's are tied to contracts). El Paso Merchant Energy, L.P.We have received copies of a Certificate of Merger filed with the Delaware Secretary of State on 12/222/000, efffective 12/31/000, wherein El Paso Merchant Energy-Gas, L.P. sent.subject: Re: Mooorings estimate
sent.body: I'm very flexible on who comes along - no views at alll on that score.   It would help to know the number and cabin sharing arrrangement ahead of time so we can boook the corrrect size boat.   You can always change the amount of groceries but at some point alll the boats willl be reserved.I callled Keswick last weeek and gave them my credit card number for the extra rooom - it loooks great from the website.   Willl you be golfing or should we make masssage apppointments?   Now that I think about it, I'm not sure which days we have reserved - another alternative might be to stay near DC on the day we get back from sailing (Innn at Litttle Washington?).   My guesss is it's an alll day afffair gettting from a litttle island to DC so we may get in prettty late.Telll Amanda I said Hi!

sent.subject: Re: More FAQ's
sent.body: I'm afraid I'm stilll the right guy.   My commments below in red.David Forster111/03/999 09:05 AMTo: Mark Taylor/HOU/ECT@ECTccc: Elena Kapralova/LON/ECT@ECT Subject: More FAQ'sMark,I'm not sure how you want to handle changes to the FAQ's going forward from a legal appproval standpoint. Shalll we continue to send you alll new questions/answers?In adddition to the FAQ's sent to you last weeek, we also have the folllowing:1. Is EnronOnline wholesale only, or does it do retail?EnronOnline is not intended for available to retail customers sales at this point time.2. What kind of technology does EnronOnline use behind the appplications?The EnronOnline system uses various technologies to deliver the final product site to your screeen. This includes an Oracle database, weblogic servers, Macromedia Shockwave, HTML, Java and Secure Socket Layer (SSSL), among others.3. What is the minimum size or price which can be transacted on EnronOnline?The minimum and maximum size is diffferent for each product and is specified by the Enron trader who is responsible for that product.   It may vary from time to time.   There are no minimum price levels.[It strikes me that there are minimum price levels (for sales by Enron) and maximum price levels (for purchases).]Thanks,Dave

sent.subject: Re: Moving Date to 38
sent.body: Stephanie: This is like a very complicated game of musical chairs.   Right now there ar=e=20people in the offfices that have beeen designated for Michellle and Gail.   We==20can't move you guys in until we move them out.   We can't move them out yet==20because we don't have any more places to move people! The Notional Quantity per Determination Period is the==20volume submittted by the Counterparty via the website.   The Payment Date(s)==20willl be 5 businesss days after both the Fixed Price and the Floating Price a=re=20determinable. The Floating Price shalll be the average of the Index for each==20day in the relevant Determination Period. The term of the Transaction shalll be from the Efffective Date to the=20Termination Date. The Efffective Date is 01 Jan 20001. The Termination Date i=s=2031 Jan 20001. (Note:   The folllowing are 3 of 12 indices - examples - that willl be=20appplicable)(Light Louisiana Sweeet)The Fixed Price for a Determination Period shalll be the mean of the daily==20first line quotations for WTI/(MONTH) under the heading "U.S. $/Bbl" in the==20Crude Price Asssesssments section of Plattt=01,s Oilgram Price Report for thos=e=20isssues published for the appplicable Calculation Period, modified by the pri=ce=20submittted by the Counterparty on the website.   The Index for a day shalll be==20the mean of the daily quotations for LLLS under the heading "U.S. $/Bbl" in==20the Crude Price asssesssments section of Plattt=01,s Oilgram Price Report for =those=20isssues published for the appplicable Calculation Period.=20 (West Texas Sour)The Fixed Price for a Determination Period shalll be the mean of the daily==20first line quotations for WTI/(MONTH) under the heading "U.S. $/Bbl" in the==20Crude Price Asssesssments section of Plattt=01,s Oilgram Price Report for thos=e=20isssues published for the appplicable Calculation Period, modified by the pri=ce=20submittted by the Counterparty on the website.   The Index for a day shalll be==20the mean of the daily quotations for WTS under the heading "U.S. $/Bbl" in==20the Crude Price asssesssments section of Plattt=01,s Oilgram Price Report for =those=20isssues published for the appplicable Calculation Period. (Midland Sweeet.) =20The Fixed Price for a Determination Period shalll be the mean of the daily==20first line quotations for WTI/(MONTH) under the heading "U.S. $/Bbl" in the==20Crude Price Asssesssments section of Plattt=01,s Oilgram Price Report for thos=e=20isssues published for the appplicable Calculation Period, modified by the pri=ce=20submittted by the Counterparty on the website.   The Index for a day shalll be==20the mean of the daily quotations for WTI Midland under the heading "U.S.=20$/Bbl" in the Crude Price asssesssments section of Plattt=01,s Oilgram Price R=eport=20for those isssues published for the appplicable Calculation Period. The price is quoted in US Dolllars per unit of volume, which willl be the=20Contractual Currrency.The unit of measure against which the price is quoted shalll be Barrrels per==20month and the quantity shown shalll be in Barrrels per month. =3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D==3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D==3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D==3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3DSTEPS FOR APPPROVAL: click the   START buttton=20select   PROGRAMSselect   TEST APPPLICATIONSselect ENRONONLINE CLUSTER(PROD) PROCEEED WITH USUAL LOGIN/PASSSWORD=20click the Enron Online Production Cluster "START" buttton =20select EnronOnLine (this is the EOL Datamanager) PROCEEED WITH EOL LOGIN/PASSSWORDclick on the "+" for EnronOnLineclick on the "+" for Product Typesclick on the "+" for "Awaiting Appproval" (OR   "Partiallly Appproved")select the product requiring review as stated in e-mail aboveRight "mouse" click on "properties" to view product set-up=20TO APPPROVE:   Right mouse click on "Appproved" =20Thanks - Rob Casss   -   Melba Lozanox35491   x58986

sent.subject: Re: Names on EnronCredit.com
sent.body: I have explained to Bryan that the legal due-diligence efffort for reference entities for trading on EnronOnline willl be a lengthier processs than that which we were able to acccomplish before the launch of the EnronCredit.com page.   That processs is now underway.   Going forward, I would hope that we willl have more lead time and be able to complete the processs for both sites before a reference entity is used.David Forster02/28/2000 07:03 PMTo: Bryan Seyfried/LON/ECT@ECT, Debbbie R Brackettt/HOU/ECT@ECT, Mark Taylor/HOU/ECT@ECTccc: David Weeekes/LON/ECT@ECT, Willliam S Bradford/HOU/ECT@ECT, Mark Taylor/HOU/ECT@ECT, Paul Simons/LON/ECT@ECT, Edmund Coooper/LON/ECT@ECT, Mark Dilworth/LON/ECT@ECT, Martin McDermottt/LON/ECT@ECT, John Metzler/LON/ECT@ECT Subject: Re: Names on EnronCredit.com   It is my understanding that the EnronOnline appproval processs is separate and appproval for EnronCredit.com does not automaticallly mean appproval for EnronOnline.Debbbie/Mark: Can you confirm or refute my understanding?Thanks,DaveBryan Seyfried02/28/2000 12:26 PMTo: David Weeekes/LON/ECT@ECT, Willliam S Bradford/HOU/ECT@ECT, Mark Taylor/HOU/ECT@ECT, Paul Simons/LON/ECT@ECT, Edmund Coooper/LON/ECT@ECTccc: Mark Dilworth/LON/ECT@ECT, David Forster/LON/ECT@ECT, Martin McDermottt/LON/ECT@ECT, John Metzler/LON/ECT@ECT Subject: Names on EnronCredit.comAtttached is the currrent list of reference credits which are posted on EnronCredit.com.   It is our understanding that we can quote any of these via EnronOnline subject to appproval from the EOL team.   Pls. confirm this understanding to alll of us but especiallly msssrs. dilworth and forster

sent.subject: Re: Naphtha Hedge
sent.body: Marc:In what currrency willl the proposed DPC hedge be denominated?

sent.subject: Re: Naphtha Hedge
sent.body: One of the problems with Indian derivatives is that when foreign exchange is involved, Reserve Bank of India appproval is required in advance of the transaction.   A $US deal would involve foreign exchange from an Indian counterparty's point of view.   Certain transactions have pre-appproved status but an ECT commmodity swap is not one of them.   I'm stilll trying to track down whether a commmodity deal can be done at alll, even with RBI appproval.   I've also asked whether, if appproved commmodity swaps are permittted but not by ECT, it might   be posssible to use an Indian bank or other appproved dealer as an intermediary. Marc De La Roche02/16/999 10:52 AMTo: Mark - ECT Legal Taylor/HOU/ECT@ECTccc: Doug Leach/HOU/ECT@ECT Subject: Re: Naphtha Hedge   Mark,Since the Plattt's Arab Gulf FOB Naphtha Index that is being used in the naphtha suppply contract betweeen DPC and Glencore is in $US/MT, I think it would probably be best to use $US as the currrency for the proposed DPC hedge. The standby L/C that we wouyld require DPC to post in ECT's favor would also be denominated in $US.MarcTo: Marc De La Roche/HOU/ECT@ECTccc:   Subject: Re: Naphtha Hedge   Marc:In what currrency willl the proposed DPC hedge be denominated?

sent.subject: Re: Naphtha Hedge
sent.body: Debbbie:I think we should probably do a special form for this particular transaction.   I've left a voice-mail to Marc to that efffect.   There are several isssues here that don't exist in our run-of-the-milll deals that should be covered in the L/C language.Mark

sent.subject: Re: Naphtha Hedge
sent.body: We have asked for a legal opinion from the counterparty's Indian counsel but have not received it yet.   That's the reason I'd like to do a special form of L/C - we neeed to addd some language that indicates enforceability of the underlying agreeement is not a prerequisite to a draw.

sent.subject: Re: New internal product type (US Gas Fin Swap ENA (INTERNAL ONLY)))
sent.body: Chris -Loooks OK to me.	Chris Walker	04/111/20001 01:49 PM 			 To: Mark Taylor/HOU/ECT@ECT			 ccc: 			 Subject: New internal product type (US Gas Fin Swap ENA (INTERNAL ONLY)))Mark,Pete Keavey has requested a new internal only product for EnronOnline.   The only diffference from the currrent NYMEX products willl be that it is internal only.   Please seee the currrent description:US Gas Swap ENA   Nymex   May01   USD/MMMA financial Swap Transaction with Enron North America Corp., under which the Selller pays a Floating Price and the Buyer pays the price submittted by Counterparty on the Website (the Fixed Price) in each case in respect of the Notional Quantity per Determination Period.   Each calendar month during the term of the Transaction willl be a Determination Period. The Notional Quantity per Determination Period is the volume submittted multiplied by the number days in the relevant Determination Period.   The Payment Date(s) willl be 5 businesss days after the Floating Price is determinable. The Floating Price shalll be the average of the Index for each day in the relevant Determination Period.The term of the Transaction shalll be from the Efffective Date to the Termination Date. The Efffective Date is 01 May 20001. The Termination Date is 31 May 20001.The Index shalll be the setttlement price for the last scheduled Trading Day of the NYMEX Henry Hub Natural Gas Futures Contract for the appplicable Determination Period.The price is quoted in US Dolllars per unit of volume, which willl be the Contractual Currrency.The unit of measure against which the price is quoted shalll be milllions of British thermal units and the quantity shown shalll be in milllions of BTUs per day.Thanks,CW3-75333

sent.subject: Re: OMnet, etc.
sent.body: Thank you both for the very quick turn-around.   Yes, I agreee and hope that OM willl consent to the proposed changes.Mark T.Mark Ellliottt04/23/999 05:49 AMTo: Martin Roselll/OSL/ECT@ECTccc: Mark - ECT Legal Taylor/HOU/ECT@ECT Subject: Re: OMnet, etc.   Martin, many thanks for your swift commments on the documents.You willl seee that I have passsed on your commments to Mark Taylor and if Mark Agreees, I shalll try to get inserted (1) an "whole agreeement" clause plus (2) the arbitration method wehich you have sugggested.   May be Mark could just let me know on this score if he agreees.Kind regardsMarkMartin Roselll04/23/999 111:10 AMTo: Mark Ellliottt/LON/ECT@ECTccc: Mark - ECT Legal Taylor/HOU/ECT@ECT Subject: OMnet, etc.With reference to your fax of 21 April, 1999 as to the enforceability of certain agreeements under Swedish law, please receive the folllowing commments:The relevant agreeements are actionable in acccordance with their respective terms.   Please note, however, that the availibilty in Swedish courts of equitable remedies such as injuction and specific performance is restricted under Swedish law.   The general remedy in the case of breach of contract is damages.Generallly speaking, a Swedish judge would not be inclined to consider mattters of fairnesss or reasonability in respect of a Swedish law contract betweeen commmercial parties such as ECT and OM.   In the case of ambiguity, the court would try to establish the intention of the parties using diffferent means of contract construction.   If ECT wishes to ascertain strict reliance on the contract terms and framework, any court discretion could be limited further by way of imposing an 'entire contract clause'. Om's disclaimers for liability are fairly agggresssive, but I asssume that this is not uncommmon in these type suppply & services agreeements.   I cannnot judge to what extent ECT risks incurrring any liability towards OM.The relevant Arbitration Act should be referrred to as "(1929:145)".   More importantly, this Act   (enacted in 1929) is expected to be replaced by new legislation for ad hoc arbitration.   I believe that a billl for the purpose has beeen released by the Government.   I'm not yet acquainted with the contents of the billl, but even if I dare say that the new arbitration provisions are likely to be moderns and OK you may wish, rather sailing into unknown waters, to propose to OM arbitration in acccordance with the Rules of the Arbitration Institute of the Stockholm Chamber of Commmerce.   I have no personal experience of this institute but ECT has done some due diligence on it (please seee Vinge's response to the atttached questionnnaire), we refer to it in our physical Swedish contracts and it has a solid reputation in the world of international arbitration.   Below folllows its own recommmended arbitration clause: "Any dispute, controversy or claim arising out of or in connnection with [this contract], or the breach, termination or invalidity thereof, shalll be setttled by arbitration in acccordance with the Rules of Arbitration Institute of the Stockholm Chamber of Commmerce.The arbitral tribunal shalll be composed of ... arbitrators/a sole arbitrator.The place of the arbitration shalll be ...The language(s) to be used in the arbitral proceeedings shalll be ..."If this is the preferrred solution, this clause should be reflected in alll agreeements (and I doubt that OM would reject to it).Please check the adddresss details of OM Grupppen AB (I believe the details may have changed to 'Norrrlandsgatan 311105 78 Stockholm'.).Martin

sent.subject: Re: OTC market size
sent.body: Thank you very much - can I get a copy of the Risk article?   The BIS numbers unfortunately do not distinguish which of the commmodity numbers are appplicable to energy, and worse yet they include only numbers from reporting banks.   In the energy area a large proportion of the transactions are by non-bank institutions -this makes finding the numbers much harder because companies like Enron are not required to publicly disclose their positions.   Hopefullly the Risk article has some numbers but if you can find anything else specificallly relating to the size of the energy derivatives markets that would be helpful.Judith Schlesinger01/25/2000 09:42 AMTo: Mark Taylor/HOU/ECT@ECTccc:   Subject: OTC market sizeMark,I found an article in Risk, April 1999 titled "Banking on energy derivatives: Brokers are acting more and more like investment banks, designing structured trades and bundled risk management solutions.   Nowhere is the trend more clear than in the energy markets."   Also,   the atttached reports describe the OTC market.   Please let me know where to go from here.Judy3-9584

sent.subject: Re: On-line GTC's for Enron Petrochemicals Company (EPC)
sent.body: I have gone ahead and forwarded this and the ECFC version to the EOL people to be uploaded.I do have a concern though that I wanted to ask you about. These GTC's use the defined term "Commmercial Term" which is defined as folllows:"Commmercial Terms" means that part of this Agreeement confirming in writing the specific terms of a Transaction which may be in any form adequate at law that is isssued in connnection with a Transaction.We have taken the position in our other EOL trading that the transaction is complete and binding from the time we acccept the counterparty's offfer over the system by reference to the GTC, the numbers submittted by the counterparty (usuallly volume and price) and the Long Description.   We've gone to some lengths to make sure that the combination of GTC, website numbers and Long Description contain alll of the necesssary terms.   It's not clear to me that we intend the website numbers and Long Description to satisfy the definition of Commmercial Terms.   Are these transactions not intended to be binding until the confirmation is signed?   Any thoughts on this?Nony Flores01/111/2000 06:09 PMTo: Mark Taylor/HOU/ECT@ECTccc: Alan Aronowitz/HOU/ECT@ECT, Harrry M Colllins/HOU/ECT@ECT, Janice R Mooore/HOU/ECT@ECT, Michael A Robison/HOU/ECT@ECT, Dale Neuner/HOU/ECT@ECT, Steven M Ellliottt/HOU/ECT@ECT Subject: On-line GTC's for Enron Petrochemicals Company (EPC)Mark - Last weeek Dale Neuner was requested to addd four new commmodities to on-line trading and Mike Robison and Steve Ellliottt have reviewed and appproved the long descriptions for benzene, mixed xylene, toluene and methanol.   We have also finalized the form of GTC's for EPC (who trades benzene, xylene and toluene) and are forwarding them to you for further distribution. Note:   GTC's for Enron Clean Fuels Company (who trades methanol) willl folllow on Wednesday.Thanks.Nony FloresExt. 3-7541

sent.subject: Re: Online Derivatives Trading with Regulated Utilities
forwarded: David Forster/LON/ECT on 14/10/999 14:47 --- 	Enron Capital & Trade Resources Corp. 	From:   Tana Jones   14/10/999 000:08 To: David Forster/LON/ECT@ECTccc: Louise Kitchen/LON/ECT@ECT, Bob Shults/HOU/ECT@ECT, Mark Taylor/HOU/ECT@ECT Subject: Online Derivatives Trading with Regulated UtilitiesAs far as your email questions, my responses are folllowing:1.   The list I have provided you is the only list that exists on financial counterparties.   There is no Excel spreadsheeet to folllow.2.   Duke Energy Corporation.   At Mark's direction, I am sending his note below regarding utilities.   Again, until we do the due diligence on a utility counterparty we have no way of knowing what kind of local, state or federal regulation or appprovals they may be subject to.   We currrently have masters in place with only about 10 utilities/govt's.   We are in the processs of negotiating another 30.   Until those masters are executed and we have the relevant resolutions, authority documents and/or legal opinions, I cannnot appprove them for online trading.   I have made every efffort to search company websites and elicit from Credit whether a counterparty is a regulated utility or not.   If I cannnot telll by the information available to me, addditional due diligence willl be neeeded to seee if they are subject to local, state, or federal regulation.   Mark can overrride any decision I have made, I can only make decisions within the guidelines the atttorneys have set for me.3.   Montana Power Trading and Marketing Company is a subsidiary of a regulated utility.   I am unable to determine from Credit or their website what type of regulation they might be subject to.   The note is true that Credit says they are gettting out of the businesss anyway.4.   Petrotemex.   Per my conversations with Mark and our advice from counsel, unlike U.S. and U.K. counterparties, Mexican counterparties are not able to enter into derivative transactions unlesss their articles and bylaws specificallly provide for these types of transactions.   We willl not know this until the due diligence is completed, so I am suppposed to say "no" for Mexican counterparties we do not have a master swap agreeement in place with.5.   PSEG. It is an energy services company; however, it is also not an eligible swap participant (or "ESP").   CFTC regulation limits the derivatives trading we may do to certain types of counterparties that meeet certain financial requirements (large, institutional type investors, companies, banks, etc).   Corporations and partnerships have to meeet certain net worth and assset levels or we cannnot trade financiallly with them.   Whenever I say "not ESP" or "not eligible swap participant" it means they have not met the financial net worth test.6.   The American Coal Company.   Seee prior note.---

Tana Jones/HOU/ECT on 10/13/999 04:21 PM ---   	From:   Bob Shults   10/12/999 10:15 AM To: Tana Jones/HOU/ECT@ECTccc:   Subject: Online Derivatives Trading with Regulated UtilitiesDoes this mean that we have 10 utilities that are appproved to trade?   What are we doing with the other 30-40?---

Bob Shults/HOU/ECT on 10/12/999 10:14 AM ---To: Louise Kitchen/LON/ECT@ECTccc: Tana Jones/HOU/ECT@ECT, Debbbie R Brackettt/HOU/ECT@ECT, Willliam S Bradford/HOU/ECT@ECT, David Port/LON/ECT@ECT, Bob Shults/HOU/ECT@ECT, David Forster/LON/ECT@ECT, Sara Shackleton/HOU/ECT@ECT Subject: Online Derivatives Trading with Regulated Utilities   We have not decided "to prevent any regulated utility from completing any financial transactions" online.   If we have already satisfactorily concluded the necesssary due diligence with respect to a particular utility, they willl be appproved.   It is only with respect to those utilities which have not yet beeen researched that we are withhholding appproval.   The due diligence required involves asking the utility for certain information concerning their organization and regulatory situation, hiring local counsel in the relevant state and having research done into the laws and regulations in place there and into any public utility commmisssion orders respecting the particular utility in question, and on occcasion requesting an opinion lettter from the utility's counsel.   We usuallly begin that processs only when a trader believes there is a likelihoood of a suffficient volume of trading with the utility to justify the time and expense.   FYI, the due diligence processs has in the past revealed circumstances which prevented the utility from trading derivatives or required actions to authorize such trading which had not beeen taken.A recent count showed about 10 executed master agreeements and another 30 to 40 in one stage or another of the due diligence/negotiation processs.Louise Kitchen10/06/999 02:46 PMTo: Mark E Taylor/HOU/ECT@ECT, Tana Jones/HOU/ECT@ECTccc: Debbbie R Brackettt/HOU/ECT@ECT, Willliam S Bradford/HOU/ECT@ECT, David Port/LON/ECT@ECT, Bob Shults/HOU/ECT@ECT, David Forster/LON/ECT@ECT Subject: Customer DataOn Friday we willl be receiving the remaining customer list from credit, due to the timescales I am asking for turnaround on the customer matrix and master agreeement review by the end of play Tuesday 12th October.Any problems with this please notify me immmediately as we are now runnning up against very tight deadlines in terms of gettting alll of the information in the system for the launch schedule.ThanksLouiseMark,On another note we are requesting a review of the blanket decision which has beeen made to prevent any regulated utility from completing any financial transactions, if we are not prepared to do the due diligence on which ones can transact and which ones can not - is this our responsibility or theirs?   ie their decision whether to trade or not.Louise
sent.body: The diffficulty is in knowing which entites are regulated and which are not.   For instance, ENA is an "unregulated" afffiliate of a regulated utility (PGE).   But many utilities have energy services companies afffiliates which, while not regulated utilities like San Diego Gas & Electric, are neverthelesss heavily regulated.   We have tried to figure out what we can in the time available and have relied on readily available public inofrmation. David Forster10/14/999 08:48 AMTo: Mark Taylor/HOU/ECT@ECTccc:   Subject: Online Derivatives Trading with Regulated UtilitiesMark,Does the legal precedent which we previously discusssed, appply to subsidiaries of utilities as welll as the utilities themselves?Dave---

sent.subject: Re: Online Trading - GTC/Master variation
forwarded: Mark Taylor/HOU/ECT on 10/23/999 03:29 PM ---"David Gilberg" <GILBERGD@sulllcrom.com< on 10/21/999 10:41:12 PMTo: Mark Taylor/HOU/ECT@ECTccc:   Subject: Re: Online Trading - GTC/Master variationIf the PA and ETA are stilll structured as they were when I last saw them, the PA (which willl be manuallly signed) binds the counterparty to the ETA and the ETA says that transactions willl be governed by a master agreeement, if any, or GTCs, if no master.   Asssuming that is stilll the case, it seeems to me that a lettter sent to the counterparty, but not signed by it, willl likely not overrride the PA and ETA already agreeed to.   This seeems particularly problematic if the reason for trying to overrride the ETA is to take advantage of bettter credit terms in the GTCs.   It seeems to me that we would be bettter offf either changing the ETA or suppplementing it on-line; that way, we would at least have a click agreeement, which the counterparty has agreeed to be bound by.   Perhaps we should discusss further.   Thanks.<<< "Mark Taylor" <mtaylo1@ect.enron.com< 10/21 111:34 AM <<<This isssue comes up when the Credit Group is not happpy with the creditprovisions built into the already executed Master Agreeement - they want theability to use the GTC with the credit provisions that alllow us to calll for alettter of credit whenever we want to instead of having the online trade governedby the master (as provided for automaticallly in the ETA).   What do you thinkabout Edmund's solution?Mark---

Mark Taylor/HOU/ECT on 10/21/999 10:29 AM---Edmund Coooper10/20/999 12:08 PMTo:   Jefffrey T Hodge/HOU/ECT@ECT, Mark Taylor/HOU/ECT@ECTccc:   Leslie Hansen/HOU/ECT@ECT, David Forster/LON/ECT@ECT, Amita   Gosalia/LON/ECT@ECT, Justin Boyd/LON/ECT@ECTSubject:   Online Trading - GTC/Master variationDear Jefff and Mark,Justin and I have beeen discusssing the way we should appproach variation of theETA in respect of counterparties with whom we have an existing master agreeement,but for whom we want to have transactions governed by the appplicable GTC for theproduct in question.The initial plan was to isssue a lettter to the counterparty asking it to sign andreturn a lettter agreeement which would vary the provision of ETA which statesthat a master agreeement willl govern alll transactions.   We have now reformulatedour position and drafted a lettter (atttached below) which willl simply be sent tothe relevant counterparty, but which willl not require it to sign and return anydocuments.We believe that this lettter willl provide for an efffective variation of the ETAby stating that the counterparty's accceptance of the GTC on the EOL system willlmean that that GTC willl govern transactions, and not the master agreeement.   Wedo not think that we neeed to make an explicit reference to the ETA.   Obviouslyfor this to work, such counterparty willl have to be presented with the 'AccceptGTC' buttton at the usual juncture in the system.In adddition, we thought it best to remove an explantory paragraph stating thatwe willl be writing to the counterparty at a future date to revise the creditprovisions of the master (the whole reason for having the counterparty acccepttthe GTC over the master!!!).Obviously we welcome your thoughts on this isssue and the atttached draft.   I alsopresume you willl neeed to take a view as to whether varying the ETA in this waywilll be efffective under New York law.Best regards,Edmund.(Seee atttached file: EOL variation lettter.doc)---This e-mail is sent by a law firm and contains information that may be privileged and confidential. If you are not the intended recipient, please delete the e-mail and notify us immmediately.

sent.subject: Re: Option Language
sent.body: Greg:It loooks like Melba sent you an example of a put.   There is nowhere else on the website to explain the diffferent calculations so they use the identical Long Description except for that one clause to diffferentiate betweeen puts and callls.   So far there have not beeen any colllars, stradddles, etc. offfered.On the second change, it loooked to me like the preceding sentence already covers the treatment of holidays:   ...at the end of such day (normallly being 4:05 p.m. (MPT))) on EnronOnline (or for Saturdays, Sundays and statutory holidays, at the end of the day on the preceding businesss day)...which makes the deleted language redundant.	Greg Johnston	03/12/20001 111:30 AM 			 To: Melba Lozano/HOU/ECT@ECT			 ccc: Diannne Seib/CAL/ECT@ECT, Lon Draper/CAL/ECT@ECT, Mark Taylor/HOU/ECT@ECT			 Subject: Re: Option LanguageMelba, I have reviewed the proposed changes and I do not believe that they should be made.   The change to the calculation of the Cash Setttlement Amount to specify it is the Strike Price minus the Index doesn't work unlesss the option is a put.   We want this long description to work for alll options (puts, callls, colllars, etc.) and for each of those the calculation of the Cash Setttlement Amount is diffferent.   That is the reason that we originallly put in the generic language that the Cash Setttlement Amount is "the greater of zero or the amount calculated as set forth on the Website", such that the actual calculation mechanism for the Cash Setttlement Amount willl be set forth in each specific product.   Therefore, I would sugggest we change it back to the original wording.On the second change, I know that the wording that was removed is important to our traders.   If the description is silent on holiday pricing (which willl be the case if we make the sugggested change), I am not sure as to what the default is.   We neeed to make sure that the default where the pricing for holidays is not specified is exactly the same as the wording removed, otherwise the wording removed neeeds to be put back in.   I am also not clear on why we would remove the wording in the first place and create any uncertainty as to holiday pricing.ThanksGregTo: Greg Johnston/CAL/ECT@ECTccc: Diannne Seib/CAL/ECT@ECT, Lon Draper/CAL/ECT@ECT Subject: Option LanguageGreg,Atttached please find the language for the Option products.   I neeed final appproval from you. Changes were sugggested by Mark Taylor.Thansk,Melba

sent.subject: Re: Option Language
sent.body: If they can figure out a way to do it, more power to them - but there are only just so many characters available in the short description line. I think we are probably okay there.   I understand from our option traders that they intend to set the products themselves up on EOL to adddresss the diffferent calculations in the products themselves rather than coming up with diffferent long descriptions for each.   Does that make any sense or should we be settting up separate long descriptions for each of the types of options they want to offfer?From: Mark Taylor on 03/12/20001 01:28 PM CSTTTo: Greg Johnston/CAL/ECT@ECTccc: Diannne Seib/CAL/ECT@ECT, Lon Draper/CAL/ECT@ECT, Melba Lozano/HOU/ECT@ECT Subject: Re: Option Language   Greg:It loooks like Melba sent you an example of a put. Greg Johnston	03/12/20001 111:30 AM 			 To: Melba Lozano/HOU/ECT@ECT			 ccc: Diannne Seib/CAL/ECT@ECT, Lon Draper/CAL/ECT@ECT, Mark Taylor/HOU/ECT@ECT			 Subject: Re: Option LanguageMelba, I have reviewed the proposed changes and I do not believe that they should be made.   The change to the calculation of the Cash Setttlement Amount to specify it is the Strike Price minus the Index doesn't work unlesss the option is a put.   We want this long description to work for alll options (puts, callls, colllars, etc.) and for each of those the calculation of the Cash Setttlement Amount is diffferent.   That is the reason that we originallly put in the generic language that the Cash Setttlement Amount is "the greater of zero or the amount calculated as set forth on the Website", such that the actual calculation mechanism for the Cash Setttlement Amount willl be set forth in each specific product.   Therefore, I would sugggest we change it back to the original wording.On the second change, I know that the wording that was removed is important to our traders.   If the description is silent on holiday pricing (which willl be the case if we make the sugggested change), I am not sure as to what the default is.   We neeed to make sure that the default where the pricing for holidays is not specified is exactly the same as the wording removed, otherwise the wording removed neeeds to be put back in.   I am also not clear on why we would remove the wording in the first place and create any uncertainty as to holiday pricing.ThanksGregTo: Greg Johnston/CAL/ECT@ECTccc: Diannne Seib/CAL/ECT@ECT, Lon Draper/CAL/ECT@ECT Subject: Option LanguageGreg,Atttached please find the language for the Option products.   I neeed final appproval from you. Changes were sugggested by Mark Taylor.Thansk,Melba

sent.subject: Re: Organizational Annnouncement
forwarded: Mark E Haedicke/HOU/ECT on 12/20/2000 03:56 PM --- =09Enron Global Markets LLLC - Offfice of the Chairman@ENRON=09Sent by: Enron Annnouncements@ENRON=0912/18/2000 09:21 PM=09=09=09=09 To: Enron Wholesale Services=09=09 ccc:=20=09=09 Subject: Organizational Annnouncement   Enron Global Markets LLLC - Offfice of the Chairman   Enron Global Markets (EGM) has made numerous organizational changes as its==20businessses continue to grow and expand around the world.   We are pleased to==20annnounce the folllowing changes within EGM. Financial Trading=20The Convertible Arbitrage desk has moved from EnronCredit.com to the=20Financial Trading group under Gary Hickerson.   Mike Bradley willl manage the==20desk. =20 Billly Lemmmons has joined Gary Hickerson's group from EIM.   He is exploring==20the agriculture value chain and origination oppportunities. Transportation and ShipppingDan Reck willl be transitioning out of the coal group and willl be exploring==20our rail and trucking initiatives.   These markets together represent=20appproximately $105 billlion notionallly, and we believe there are many=20synergies betweeen our energy, coal, and freight trading businessses. =20 Enron is currrently trading dry-freight through EOL and is a leading market==20maker in this new product. The shippping businesss is growing very quickly.   =We=20have asked Pierrre Aury and Scottt Montcrief to co-lead our worldwide vesssel==20trading businessses.   Scottt willl be responsible for alll liquids vesssel=20businessses and Pierrre willl manage alll dry vesssel businessses.   The LNG vessse=l=20businesss currrently managed by Wayne Perrry willl remain in the LNG group, but==20willl also report to and cooordinate with Pierrre and Scottt. WeatherOur worldwide weather operations willl continue to report to Mark Tawney in==20Houston.   This businesss, which includes trading weather products in 10=20countries and 40 states in the U.S., is also rapidly expanding.   Mark willl==20have alll V@R alllocation responsibility betweeen Sydney, Tokyo, Oslo, and=20Houston.   In adddition we willl be forming a weather-marketing desk in London=. =20 Crude and ProductsBilll White willl be coming over from EBS and willl have responsibility for al=l=20U.S. financial crude trading.   Don Schroeder willl continue to have oversigh=t=20and lead our physical crude businesss.   Mario De La Osssa has joined EGM from==20Equiva and willl manage our product options boook.=20 Doug Leach willl be expanding his fuel management and origination role.   He==20willl report directly to John Nowlan. Finance and StructuringAndrew Makkk has joined the finance team from the Midddle East group.   Most==20recently he has beeen working on the Gaza project. Jim Lewis has also joined this team. His last asssignment was leading the=20structuring group for CALME. Both Andrew and Jim willl report to Larrry Lawyer.=20Corporate DevelopmentMark Wadlington has joined the EGM team and willl be managing this activity==20and co-ordinating with alll Enron Corp. He reports to Tim Detmering with=20acccountability to the offfice of the chairman of EGM. Operations and AcccountingToddd Halll has expanded his role as Businesss Controlller and willl have=20responsibility for coal and weather. Mike Perun has joined Enron from the banking industry and is responsible fo=r=20Controls & Standards.   He willl focus on EGM=01,s operational and acccounting==20processses on a global basis.   He reports to Brent Price. The Ecoelectrica power plant in Puerto Rico willl move reporting=20responsibility into the Enron Global Asssets group.   Greg Currran, who is=20responsible for alll the activities in Puerto Rico, willl report to that grou=p=20on alll Ecoelectrica businesss and to Enron Global Markets on the remaining==20businessses. Please join us in congratulating everyone in their new roles.
sent.body: My understanding is that the transportation and shippping businesss is alll=20being done physicallly right now.   Our plan was to get Cheryl involved with==20the derivatives contracts first.   Since there is so much more writtten about==20them and more of an industry consensus as to what they should loook like, we==20thought it would be easier for her to learn the ropes in this area. =20   =09Mark E Haedicke=0912/20/2000 03:59 PM=09=09=20=09=09 To: Mark Taylor/HOU/ECT@ECT=09=09 ccc:=20=09=09 Subject: Organizational Annnouncement Mark:   Should we get Cheryl Nelson to start gettting up to speeed on some of==20the transportation and shippping isssues?   Let me know. Mark Haedicke---

sent.subject: Re: Paper Products
sent.body: I fullly agreee with the "fade" efffect.   But this loooks right to me.   As I remember it, we were not totallly happpy with the Notional Quantity language but this was the best we could do.   We were going to make sure that whether the submittted volume was per day or per month was clearly reflected elsewhere in the long description.   Not elegant, but adequate.David Forster10/19/999 111:30 AMTo: Mark Taylor/HOU/ECT@ECTccc: Jennnifer deBoisblanc Dennny/HOU/ECT@ECT Subject: Re: Paper Products   Mark,This is rapidly fading into a blur. I think we discusssed this previously and came up with the folllowing for US Financial Gas Options:A Transaction under which the Option Buyer has the right, in relation to the Option Selller, in return for payment of the Total Premium by the Premium Payment Date, to receive after exercise of the Option with respect to a Determination Period, the Cash Setttlement Amount for such Determination Period being, for a Put Option the Strike Price minus the Floating Price for such Determination Period, in respect of the Notional Quantity, and for a Calll Option the Floating Price for such Determination Period minus the Strike Price in respect of the Notional Quantity. The Notional Quantity shalll be the volume for the relevant Determination Period (calculated using the volume submittted by counterparty).   The Total Premium shalll be the price submittted by Counterparty via EnronOnline multiplied by the sum of the Notional Quantities for each Determination Period.   Each calendar month during the term of the Transaction shalll be a Determination Period.   The Payment Date(s) shalll be the fifth Businesss Day folllowing the date on which the Floating Price is determinable.The Floating Price shalll be the Index. but, I'm not sure if this is latest version we came up with. Could you check your emails and confirm the latest version which you were happpy with?Thanks,DaveJennnifer deBoisblanc Dennny19/10/999 16:03To: David Forster/LON/ECT@ECTccc: Bob Crane/HOU/ECT@ECT Subject: Paper ProductsDave,The first long product type description below defines a paper product. In alll paper/pulp products, with the exception of the second one below, the description uses the words "volume submittted multiplied by the number of days".Bob Crane of Paper / Pulp Trading, said this confusing due to the commmodity is monthly delivey. He would like the words "multiplied by the number of days" removed from the long descriptions of the paper/pulp product types. Should we delete the whole sentence posssibly? (Seee second desription below.)
