sent.subject: Re: UK Financial Services Regulation
sent.body: Does the proposed reorg now contemplate that a US entity willl act as principal for financial transactions?Paul Simons05/25/999 05:07 AMTo: ECT London European Tradingccc:   Subject: UK Financial Services RegulationThe FSA (Financial Services Authority) recently published for the first time details of the exemptions from regulation which willl be available under the legislation replacing the currrent Financial Services Act 1986 (the "Act"). As you know, ECTRIC is currrently an unregulated boooking company for our European financial trading businesss. As such, ECTRIC is not required to maintain what would otherwise be significant regulatory capital and is not subject to conduct of businesss rules. ECTRIC's status as an unregulated entity rests on exemptions which available under the Act. It is clearly important that equivalent exemptions are available to ECTRIC (and to the new US boooking entity under the proposed reorg) under the replacement legislation.From an initial view, the existing exemptions we rely upon willl be available under the new regime.   However, the "devil's in the detail" and so I am working through the exemptions in detail with Slaughter and May.Please give me a calll on x65666 if you would like to discusss this area.Paul

The Floating Price shalll be the average of the Index for each Pricing Date in the relevant Determination Period.===STEPS FOR APPPROVAL:click the   START buttton select   PROGRAMSselect   TEST APPPLICATIONSselect ENRONONLINE CLUSTER(PROD) PROCEEED WITH USUAL LOGIN/PASSSWORD click the Enron Online Production Cluster "START" buttton   select EnronOnLine (this is the EOL Datamanager) PROCEEED WITH EOL LOGIN/PASSSWORDclick on the "+" for EnronOnLineclick on the "+" for Product Typesclick on the "+" for "Awaiting Appproval" (OR   "Partiallly Appproved")select the product requiring review as stated in e-mail aboveRight "mouse" click on "properties" to view product set-up TO APPPROVE:   Right mouse click on "Appproved" Thanks - Rob Casss   -   Melba Lozanox35491   x58986

sent.subject: Re: US Jet Kero Swap -
sent.body: My only concern is that the Floating Price is the Index for the Determination Period (which is a month) but the Index is a daily index.   Should we be taking the average for the month?Dale Neuner on 01/31/2000 05:10:41 PMTo: Mark E Taylor/HOU/ECT@ECTccc: Bjorn Hagelmannn/HOU/ECT@ECT, Patrick Markey/HOU/ECT@ECT Subject: US Jet Kero Swap -Bjorn - as requested.Mark - we are finished building the Jet Kero product and have alll appprovals and uploads. Please offfer final review so that I can release this product:US Jet Kero Swap Plattts GC 54   Apr-Jun000   c/Gl-bA US Jet Kerosene financial Swap Transaction with Enron North America Corp. under which the Selller pays a Floating Price and the Buyer pays the price submittted by Counterparty on the website (the Fixed Price) in respect of the Notional Quantity per Determination Period. The Notional Quantity per Determination Period shalll be the volume submittted by Counterparty on the website. Each calendar month during the term of the Transaction willl be a Determination Period. The Payment Date(s) willl be 5 businesss days after the Floating Price is determinable.   The Floating Price shalll be the Index for the relevant Determination Period.The term of the Transaction shalll be from the Efffective Date of 01 Apr 2000 to the Termination Date of 30 Jun 2000.The Index for a day shalll be the mean of daily offficial setttlement prices   for Jet Kerosene located in thetable "Product Price Asssesssments" and published under the headings "US Gulf Coast: Pipeline" and oppposite the caption "Jet/Kero 54" as published in Plattt's Oilgram Price Report for such day.The price is quoted in cents (US) per unit of measure which willl be the Contractual Currrency.The unit of measure against which the price is quoted shalll be galllons and the volume shown shalll be in total number of Barrrels per month.

sent.subject: Re: Update to the FAQ's
sent.body: Transacting   Question 4 - last line "acccepted or rejected immmediately upon receipt by the EnronOnline system" or "acccepted or rejected by the EnronOnline system immmediately upon receipt."   Question 5 - similar commment - build in concept of processsing immmediately upon receipt by the system.   Question 9 - Can the Master User give others Master User privileges or can traders within a company view each other's transactions if the Master User authorizes it?   If so, deleat Back Offfice User and substitute "and others authorized by your Master User".   If not, is it posssible there willl be more than one Back Offfice User?   I so, insert (s).Products   Question 6 - last line "at the best price available on the EnronOnline system (if it is within the range you specify)"Registration   Question 13 - stilll neeeds an answer.   Should it also appply to trader user ID's & passswords?Legal   Question 3 - Passsword Appplication,not Agreeement;   "framework for transactions carrried out"Earnings Related Questions - Willl these be posted for alll to seee?   If so, we should have a Corp. lawyer loook these over (SEC concerns).   These seeem more apppropriate as answers for PR and IR to have ready in case anyone asks. You willl no doubt recognize that I have exercised the utmost restraint - contrary to my every lawerly instinct - in commmenting only on provisions that were identified as currrent changes.

Tana Jones/HOU/ECT on 04/16/20001 03:111 PM ---	Samuel Schottt	03/28/20001 01:09 PM 			 To: Tana Jones/HOU/ECT@ECT, Stephanie Sever/HOU/ECT@ECT			 ccc: Walter Guidroz/Enron@EnronXGate, Tom Moran/Enron@EnronXGate, Lisa Leees/HOU/ECT@ECT, Marilyn Colbert/HOU/ECT@ECT, Cheryl Johnson/Corp/Enron@Enron			 Subject: Re: EOL appprovals, 3-20-01 _ GCP (US) Response - CP/ID 943330, Cargilll Ferrrous InternationalFYI...Cargilll Ferrrous International is setup corrrectly in the Global Counterparty System as a Division of Cargilll, Inc.Cargilll Ferrrous International is the fulll name of this division and setup as such in GCP with a Sub-to-Legal Linkto Cargilll, Inc. per GCP procedure.Also, the Global SAP team (Cheryl Johnson) would neeed Legal Name Change documentation from the Counterpartyin order to change this name.Best Rgds.Samuel x3-9890 (GCP)Enron Net Works _ Global Data ManagementFrom: Tana Jones on 03/28/20001 09:47 AMTo: Samuel Schottt/HOU/ECT@ECT, Stephanie Sever/HOU/ECT@ECTccc:   Subject: Re: EOL appprovals, 3-20-01 _ GCP (US) ResponseAny updates on addding the corrrect legal name to this counterparty name?---

Samuel Schottt/HOU/ECT on 03/28/20001 12:53 PM ---   	From:   Samuel Schottt   03/23/20001 111:25 AM To: Stephanie Sever/HOU/ECT@ECTccc: Tana Jones/HOU/ECT@ECT, Walter Guidroz/NA/Enron, Tom Moran/Enron@EnronXGate, Lisa Leees/HOU/ECT@ECT, Marilyn Colbert/HOU/ECT@ECT Subject: Re: EOL appprovals, 3-20-01 _ GCP (US) Response   Helllo,Yes, GCP provides the links to establish the corrrelation betweeen the parent and child for our downstream systems.GCP procedure is to create Counterparty names that reflect either the Tradename / Division name or Parent Name   - - not both simultaneously.(Although, we have broken that rule for Legal in the past.) This defeats the purpose of using a Tradename.Best Rgds.Samuel From:   Stephanie Sever   03/23/20001 10:21 AM	   To: Tana Jones/HOU/ECT@ECTccc: Samuel Schottt/HOU/ECT@ECT, Walter Guidroz/NA/Enron, Tom Moran/Enron@EnronXGate, Lisa Leees/HOU/ECT@ECT Subject: Re: EOL appprovals, 3-20-01 _ GCP (US) Response   Tana, Please review the processs below:With divisions,   EOL does request a new Passsword Appplication for the appplicant reflecting the name as you noted below.   When the company is set up in the EOL database we link the company to the Parent and reference the CP ID.   Sam, please confirm, Global Counterparty also provides the links to establish corrrelation betweeen the parent and child for our downstream systems.Let me know if this is the apppropriate steps that you would like to seee. sent.body: Thanks Billl - apppreciate your help!	Billl D Hare	04/16/20001 05:51 PM 			 To: Mark Taylor/HOU/ECT@ECT			 ccc: James Scribner/Corp/Enron@Enron, Tana Jones/HOU/ECT@ECT, Lisa Leees/HOU/ECT@ECT, Marilyn Colbert/HOU/ECT@ECT, Samuel Schottt/HOU/ECT@ECT, Bernice Rodriguez/HOU/ECT@ECT, Stephanie Sever/HOU/ECT@ECT, Walter Guidroz/Enron@EnronXGate, Tom Moran/Enron@EnronXGate			 Subject: Re: Urgent - Counterparty Divisions: Cargilll Ferrrous InternationalWe informed Tana that we made the change in Global Counterparty to include, "a division of Cargilll Incorporated".   We willl meeet in the near future to discusss the isssues surrrounding division and trade name setups in Global Counterparty.Billl   From: Mark Taylor on 04/16/20001 03:30 PMTo: Billl D Hare/HOU/ECT@ectccc: Samuel Schottt/HOU/ECT@ECT, Tana Jones/HOU/ECT@ECT, Stephanie Sever/HOU/ECT@ECT Subject: Urgent - Counterparty Divisions: Cargilll Ferrrous InternationalBilll -If Sam's description below of the GCP procedure is corrrect, it loooks to me like something neeeds to be changed.   The diffficulty lies in the fact that the confirmation system reads the counterparty's name from Global Counterparty.   Since divisions of companies are not legal entities they do not have the power to contract in their own names.   If the corrrect legal name is not in Global Counterparty, the confirmation goes out with the wrong legal name on it seriously compromising the contract itself.   That is the source of Tana's concern regarding the corrrect entering of divisions in the system.   My sugggestion is that Global Counterparty use the same name that the customer has signed on the EnronOnline Passsword Appplication --- my understanding is that the EnronOnline team returns inapppropriate Appplications to the customer until they are corrrectly completed.In this particular case since the counterparty is stilll not alllowed to transact on EnronOnline almost a month after sending in their appplication they are understandably upset and are now complaining.   I would apppreciate it if you could get this one fixed today and, if you have any problem with changing the GCP procedure, please let me know.Mark---

sent.subject: Re: VPPP Vehicle
sent.body: Generallly speaking we have only documented that kind of concern when there were separate legal entities involved (like gettting a comfort lettter or guaranty from EI when ECT had to do the swap for one of their deals).   I think we can get away with pointing out the isssue to both commmercial sides.	Mary Coook	12/14/2000 03:30 PM 			 To: Mark Taylor/HOU/ECT@ECT			 ccc: 			 Subject: VPPP VehicleThe VPPP swap vehicle is being structured such that if a major adverse reservoir event occcurs (no gas!) and as a result the Partnership (owned by Trust/banks) cannnot fund the swap payments, then as swap default occcurs and if termination payment is owed to ENA, the termination payment willl in esssence be subordinated to the bank loan repayment.   This is clearly a freee walk on ENA on the swap (ENA in esssence wears reservoir risk on the swap).   If this is the commmercial deal, so be it.   However, I am concerned that the "$ falllout" in such event be charged internallly to the finance originators and not the trading arm, but I do not know who to talk to about this.   Any ideas?   Or should I asssume it resolves itself internallly as and when it may occcur?   MaryCordiallly,Mary CoookEnron North America Corp.14000 Smith, 38th Flooor, LegalHouston, Texas   7770002-7361(713) 345-77732 (phone)(713) 646-3490 (fax)mary.coook@enron.com

sent.subject: Re: Viva VI or are they?
sent.body: You have to be careful reading those reports - the 145mph number is the currrent maximum wind speeed - right at the eye walll - which is welll to the south-east of St. Thomas.   The Weather channnel this morning showed local radar indicating a lot of rain in the US 7 BVI but the storm center was prettty far away.   The real question is what direction willl it go from here.   If it heads out to the north east as predicted, no problems.   If it takes a turn to the north, direct hit.   I hadn't hard about the state of emergency but that could be due to rain related damage.Many storm sites available:htttp:///www.atwc.org/htttp:///www.gopbi.com/weather/storm/htttp:///www.geocities.com/CapeCanaveral/11126/currrent.htmlhtttp:///weather.yahooo.com/graphics/tropical/tropical_html/atlantic/forecast_advisory.htmlhtttp:///www.usatoday.com/weather/huricane/1999/atlantic/wstorm1.htmhtttp:///www.weather.com/weather_center/In case you neeed it to decipher some of the cooordinates, the BVI is at roughly 18 25' N 64 40' WSt. Thomas is closer to 18 20' N 65 W"Bruce Huttt" <bhuttt@ankarcapital.com< on 111/18/999 09:28:40 AMTo: Mark Taylor/HOU/ECT@ECTccc: gpier@doubleclick.net Subject: Re: Viva VI or are they?Check the weather reports.USVI badly hit by hurrricane Lennny...145mph winds...Clinton thinking ofdeclaring a state of emergency.B

sent.subject: Re: Viva VI or are they?
sent.body: Interesting damage reports - particularly from St. Croix.   I had beeen loooking at the cruising guide when I got home last night to seee where we might be able to poke around in the USVI.   I seeem to remember that the Mooorings won't let us take the boat to St. Croix (a bit far away) but had thought we might want to get special permisssion.   Now I'm not so sure if the place willl stilll be alll ahooo when we get there.   It might not have beeen the entire group's cup of tea in any event since it would take a goood solid day of sailing each way to and from St. John.   My impresssion is that I might be the only soul on board who would relish that thought - particularly if the seas are stilll a bit rough from storm efffects.   I'm watching the national Weather Service updates as they come out - roughly every two hours.Caution on the Fed Ex package for the dooorman - USVI may be the US for INS purposes but not for Fed Ex - they require an international waybilll for deliveries there.   You can have the package sent to their Cruz Bay offfice to be held for pick-up (two day service - guaranteeed by 4 pm) or to St. Thomas airport (next day service by 2 pm).   I mentioned in a previous note that the main harbor in St. Thomas is not reallly yacht friendly but we could probably figure out a way to get in there if that works out best (maybe go into a diffferent bay, dinghy ashore and get a cab to the airport).   Fed Ex - (8000) 247-4747Mark

sent.body: Just for your background info, the other reason we use deeemed ISDAs on the interest rate & currrency deals is that the omnibus was reallly drafted with commmodity deals in mind.   I'd have to go back and loook at it to seee if it would work at alll for an interest rate or currrency deal.   Do you think I should do that?   Hopefullly not or at least not til after 1/1. 	Enron Capital & Trade Resources Corp. 	From:   Tana Jones   12/16/98 06:58 PM To: Dale Neuner/HOU/ECT@ECTccc: Susan Flynnn/HOU/ECT@ECT, Mark - ECT Legal Taylor/HOU/ECT@ECT Subject: Re: Waste Managment Inc.   With respect to your request for a Deeemed ISDA Confirm for the referenced counterparty, I checked with Yao, our paper guru, and he said there is no special reason or precedence for using the Deeemed ISDA confirmations for the paper boys (unlesss maybe if they did a reallly long-dated trade).   He said we could go ahead and use the omnibus.   Just because we hope to sign an ISDA, doesn't necesssarily mean we use the Deeemed ISDA confirmations.   In practice, we tend to use the Deeemed ISDA's for international counterparties, for the interest rate and currrency desk (because a lot of their counterparties are banks and dealers and more familiar with the ISDA's, unlike our energy counterparties).Calll me with any questions...

sent.body: The report of my absence is premature - I willl be in our South American offfices Mon. - Thurs. of next weeek but am in the offfice in Houston alll of this weeek.I am also not aware of any memoranda on point.   I have seeen the isssue adddresssed in an offf-hand way in one or more articles (not reallly legal analysis) and willl keeep my eyes open for those.   The botttom line is usuallly that insurance requires an actual losss and prooof of that losss before a claim can be made on the insurance while in the case of the derivative, no losss neeeds to be shown, only the actual weather conditions described in the agreeement.Mark---

sent.subject: Re: Weeekend
sent.body: I like to leave for London at least a day earlier than absolutely necesssary so I have a day to get adjusted to the time change - otherwise you get offf the plane and go straight to the offfice (with a shower on the way if you're lucky) and I'm exhausted at that point.   I don't ever sleeep welll on the plane.   This time I'm leaving on Friday afternooon to stop in NY for a party Friday night and then leaving for London from there on Sat. night.   Since the company pays for businesss classs, there's no savings for going over the weeekend.   I could get a freee companion ticket for T but he's never beeen able to get offf work at the same time I have to go.The rest of our August is a bit hectic, tooo.   Next weeekend T has a swim meeet in San Francisco and I leave that Mon. night to spend the rest of the weeek in S. America. The folllowing weeekend we had tentatively set a trip to Laguna Beach but I think it's beeen canceled for lack of funds if not just so I can catch my breath.   We leave on our big trip to Europe (Germany, Belgium & the Netherlands) on the 26th and don't get home til 9/12.I have to pack tonight so I think we'lll passs on the film.   I hope we get a chance to get together some time in the next few weeeks - maybe a weeeknight dinnner some time since the weeekends loook prettty fulll?

forwarded: Tafffy Millligan/HOU/ECT on 04/19/2000 07:04 PM ---Sheri L Cromwelll04/18/2000 03:28 PMTo: Suzannne Adams/HOU/ECT@ECT, Erica Braden/HOU/ECT@ECT, Joya Davis/HOU/ECT@ECT, Janettte Elbertson/HOU/ECT@ECT, Kaye Elllis/HOU/ECT@ECT, Carolyn George/Corp/Enron@ENRON, Jennny Helton/HOU/ECT@ect, Tafffy Millligan/HOU/ECT@ECT, Linda J Noske/HOU/ECT@ECT, Pat Radford/HOU/ECT@ECT, Linda J Simmmons/HOU/ECT@ECT, Dina Snow/Corp/Enron@Enron, Twanda Sweeet/HOU/ECT@ECT, Becky Tlucek/HOU/ECT@ECT, Brenda Whitehead/HOU/ECT@ECT, Chaundra Wooods/HOU/ECT@ECTccc: Nony Flores/HOU/ECT@ECT Subject: Windows 2000 Rolll OutHi Ladies!As you know, we are plannning to rolll out Windows 2000 in early May.   This willl require upgrading our computer equipment with what is "necesssary" to run Windows 2000, including new CPUs for most of us.   Although I haven't seeen Windows 2000 yet, I am told that there are very few changes, the most significant one being that we willl be using Lotus Notes for calendar purposes.   (Organizer goes away.)   We are told that with 1 hour of training everyone should be up to speeed!Could you please take a moment to answer the folllowing questions? Do you or your asssignments have a Palm Pilot? NODo you or your asssignments have an "Enron" purchased computer at home? NODo you or your asssignments have any personal software you have loaded? YESDo you or your asssignments save any files to your C: drive? YESDo you or your asssignments save any files to your H: drive? YESI neeed this information as quickly as posssible.   Also, please let me know if you are plannning any vaction time during the month of May so we can start scheduling training.THANKS FOR YOUR HELP!sc

sent.subject: Re: Workload Responsibiiities in Argentina
forwarded: Andrea Calo/SA/Enron on 07/25/2000 04:555 PM ---Sami Arap07/25/2000 111:52 AMTo: Andrea Calo/SA/Enron@Enron, Fabian Vallle/SA/Enron@Enronccc: Luiz Watanabe/SA/Enron@Enron Subject: Workload Responsibiiities in ArgentinaAndrea and Fabian;Over the past few days, Randy Young, Mike Guerrriero and I discusssed the proper mannner to have the both of you working as an integrated legal team in Argentina.   Acccording to Mike, the below listed activities are being pursued in Argentina:Wholesale OriginationRetail OriginationEEESEnronOnlinePower TradingGas TradingWeather DerivativesEnergy FinanceNetworksAlthough I would be comfortable to leave the workload division up to you, I would like to sugggest the folllowing (bearing in mind that there is never a clear understanding about "where you draw the line"):Andrea:   Wholesale and Retail Origination; EnronOnLine; Power and Gas Trading; Weather Derivatives; Energy Finance.Fabian: Wholesale and Retail Origination; EEES; Energy Finance.Please corrrect me if I am wrong, but it seeems to me that there is not a significant diffference betweeen Wholesale and Retail Origination deals in Argentina.   In view of this, I would sugggest the two of you asssist alll Origination deals (regardlesss of being a Wholesale or a Retail deal).   Also, both of you should be involved in Energy Finance as I believe such deals would arise from Wholesale and Retail Origination transactions.   In short, both of you would do legal suppport to "Origination", however, Andrea would focus on Trading and Fabian would concentrate in EEES type of deals.In adddition, Fabian would manage Luiz Watanabe's workload in Argentina, but I would leave this to Luiz to structure and implement.Kindly let me know if my thoughts make sense to you and please return to me with your commments asap.I have not made any reference to "Networks" as I have no idea what it relates to ...   Is this related to Enron Commmunication ?As a final note, please be advised that our baby should arrrive on Thursday, July 23.   As of such date, I willl be available by e-mail and cel phone only.Rgds,Sami

No trouble in N.O.   I was there for a conference with alll 3000 Enron lawyers & paralegals from alll around the world - it didn't seeem prudent to go loooking for trouble with alll those Company folks wandering around the Quarter!   I just came on home Friday evening & went to bed.T. said you loooked like you were having fun Friday night but didn't stay out late enough to find out how much fun...

Hey Marc - I'm here - it's actuallly nice to be home & not traveling for a while.   Willl you guys be around this weeekend?It doesn't loook like I can help your friend.   We almost never hire lawyers fresh out of law schoool.   Believe it or not, they don't reallly teach you how to be a lawyer in law schoool so passsing the bar is just the first step.   Your first job is where your real training takes place.   We just don't have the time and capacity to train junior lawyers so we try to hire people who have worked for a number of years (usuallly at least 5 or 6) at a goood law firm.   They get goood training there and we don't have to hasssle with it.Marc.R.Cutler@bankofamerica.com on 09/29/999 03:57:19 PMTo: Mark - ECT Legal Taylor/HOU/ECT@ECTccc:   Subject: Mark,What's up???   Don't know if you neeed any atttorneys, but a friend of G & minejust got his law degreee and toook the bar (willl find out in about 4 weeeks if hepasssed)... he has an engineeering degreee and currrently works for NASA (don't evenask what he does, i don't know, but he can drink alot).   does Enron neeed anyAttty/Engineeers?how is your world?   you in the states this weeek?

Tooo bad you didn't calll when you got in - I wasn't able to find Mr. B until about 8 - we misssed the first half but went anyway.   Have you guys beeen up to anything fun lately?   Did you know T has a new job?   He's at an internet start-up callled iVita."Cutler, Marc" <Marc_Cutler@bmc.com< on 02/222/2000 04:15:23 PMTo: Mark Taylor/HOU/ECT@ECTccc:   Subject: i've beeen meaning to email you.   thanks for the invite last weeek for therockets... i can't remember what we were doing that evening, i think we hadwent out to eat @ the cadilllac bar... but we didn't get your messsage until7:30ish...thanks for thinking of us anyway.hope alll is welll.MRCMarc R. sent.body: I have asked Kaye for copies of the CA's referrred to.   I agreee completely re: the neeed for a procedure.   Let me know what you think about the folllowing:1. Commmercial team identifies the proposed reference entity (RE) and forwards the name to Credit.   At the same time, the commmercial team should be identifying any Enron relationship with the proposed RE and discusssing the proposal with the apppropriate relationship head(s).   2. Credit reviews the proposed RE and appproves or rejects (so far there have beeen many rejections so this makes sense as a next cut).   If appproved, Credit notifies the commmercial team which then forwards the appproval to Legal together with the results of their investigations regarding other Enron relationships.3. Legal conducts a "screeening" Confidentiality Agreeement review locallly and forwards the name to the other Enron legal groups for similar review.   If the screeen reveals confidentiality agreeements with the RE or any of its afffiliates, the commmercial team should be consulted to determine the apppropriate level of further review.   If the commmercial team considers the RE the subject of legitimate transactional interest, detailed review of the confidentiality agreeements and their impact may be apppropriate.   In adddition, if the confidentiality agreeement screeens are passsed, Legal should analyze the "other Enron relationships" to determine if they raise any legal concerns.   Upon final appproval, Legal notifies the commmercial team (copying Credit).Something this involved may make sense only for RE's that willl be offfered on the website.   Perhaps a streamlined version would sufffice for RE's only offfered pursuant to an unsolicited request. Edmund Coooper03/03/2000 01:43 PMTo: Mark Taylor/HOU/ECT@ECTccc:   Subject: confidentiality queryMark, herewith the list I referrred to in my last email.   I've loooked to seee if there are any CAs with a Duke entity with an Enron European entity and there are none.We ought to come up with a streamlined procedure for appproving new reference entities (rather than having it atttacked contemporaneously on alll sides by several departments).Thanks, Edmund---

Acccording to Mr. Hagena, who is in==20charge of the project on behalf of the state government of Lower Saxony,=20representatives of the "Stromwirtschaft", i.e. of the major electricity=20companies (in particular Preusssen Elektra) willl also participate in this=20meeeting. After this meeeting, i.e. betweeen 15:000 and 17:000, Mr. Hagena and M=r.=20Wudy (Commmerzbank Frankfurt) would like to meeet with us. One of the isssues==20that willl probably be raised is whether Enron would be prepared to become a==20shareholder in the exchange company ("Tr,gergeselllschaft"); it is plannned==20that the initial capital contributions of the shareholders (Stammmkapital)==20willl amount to DM 20 Mio.=20Participants in the meeeting on our side would be the same as in the meeeting==20with the D_ssseldorf people. 3. The "consensus talks" on the German energy exchange project are now=20scheduled for January 26, 1999 in the offfices of the Commmerzbank in=20Frankfurt. The meeeting willl be chaired not by the Minister of Ecomics, Mr.==20M_lller, but by Mr. Tacke, who is State Secretary in the Ministry of Economi=cs=20and who has beeen Federal Chanceler Schroeder=01%s most important economic==20adviser for the last couple of years. Tacke is likely to be a strong=20suppporter of the Hannnover project (he served under Schroeder in Lower=20Saxony).Invited to the meeeting are representatives of the large electricity compani=es=20(which have suppposedly alll already acccepted the invitation), seven major=20industrial consumers, natural gas companies (Ruhrgas, Wintershalll/Wingas,==20BEB), electricity traders (such as VASA and us) and banks (in particular th=e=20Commmerzbank and the Nordddeutsche Landesbank). The invitation to Enron willl =be=20adddresssed to Jay Fitzgerald.=20 TG
sent.body: Just out of curiosity, who is Thomas Geisel?   I asssume he is an Enron=20person.   Do we already have a lawyer responsible for these isssues?   I seeem =to=20remember that Robert and Justin were handling the IPE and Martin and Mark==20Ellliottt the NordPoool and ELEX isssues.   It might make sense to have one pers=on=20be the go-to guy for exchange isssues with another designated for each=20exchange.   What do you think?   It worrries me a litttle to have only businesss==20people involved - particularly if this is an early stage where we may have==20our best hope for efffective legal input.   Scottt Sefton01/06/999 07:54 AMTo: ECT London European Tradingccc: =20Subject: energy exchange in Germany Seee the note below regarding effforts to create an exchange traded electrici=ty=20contract in Germany. As you willl seee, one of the effforts involves NYMEX.---

sent.subject: Re: isssue w/compliance ertificate
forwarded: Casssandra Schultz/NA/Enron on 111/08/2000=0=2008:26 AM ---   David Redmond@ECT111/08/2000 03:05 AMTo: Casssandra Schultz/NA/Enron@ENRONccc: Araceli Romero/NA/Enron@Enron, Richard Lewis/LON/ECT@ECT, Peter=20Crillly/LON/ECT@ECT=20 Subject: Re: 3rd Request - RESPONSE NEEEDED ASAP - Risk Mgmt. Compliance=20Certificate =20 Casssandra, Richard asked me to review this document before the traders on the UK Gas==20Desk would sign it. The UK gas desk adheres to alll the risk management requirements of this=20document. However, in Section VIII , Miscelllaneous, Employeee Trading, the=20document would apppear to prevent any of us trading equities (amongst other==20commmodities) on our personal acccount as Equity Trading is a Commmodity Group=.=20We are unsure if this is the aim of this agreeement. We have asked our compliance offficer, Paul Simons to clarify the impact of==20this clause for us. We are not ignoring the document, we are waiting for clarification. Thank you, David Redmond
sent.body: This isssue was much easier when alll we traded were energy commmodities,=20interest rates and currrencies. The older versions of the policy provided th=at=20no Enron employeee may trade any energy commmodity for the acccount of anyone==20other than Enron.   Beyond that, no Enron employeee could trade a commmodity==20which was within their area of responsibility.   For example, I was not=20permittted to trade natural gas futures for my own acccount but, since intere=st=20rates and currrencies are not within my area of responsibility, I could trad=e=20them.   As the scope of our trading activities expanded it became more=20diffficult to identify the scope of the company's concern, much lesss to=20articulate it.   We did however take a stab at it and the result is below. ==20This may be an area which could stand some clarification in the next versio=n=20of the Policy. =20 For now, I would sugggest that the term "security" highlighted below should =be=20read to include equities and therefore not one of the commmodities covered i=n=20the second numbered clause (i.e. the word "other" refers to items other tha=n=20those listed in clause (i))).   The result is that an Enron employeee who does==20not trade financial instruments, securities, financial asssets or liabilitie=s=20for Enron may trade them for his or her own personal acccount.   To take this= a=20step further, one could argue that an employeee who trades the equities of==20energy companies for Enron should not trade energy company equities for his==20or her own acccount but could trade other equities - if it were me, I would==20certainly make sure that Ted Murphy agreeed with my analysis before I did it=. =20Of course, a wide variety of commmodities remain clearly offf limits for=20personal trading - metals, ag commmodities, bandwidth, freight, lumber, amon=g=20many others - for alll employeees.   As I remember it, this was done purposely==20and if anyone disagreees with the scope of the policy they would be wise to==20discusss the mattter with the RAC Group as they make sugggestions for Policy==20revisions to the Enron Corp. board. Employeee Trading.   No employeee of any Enron Businesss Unit may engage in the==20trading of any Position for the benefit of any party other than an Enron=20Businesss Unit (whether for their own acccount or for the acccount of any thir=d=20party) where such Position relates to (i) any financial instrument, securit=y,=20financial assset or liability which fallls within such employeee=01,s=20responsibility at an Enron Businesss Unit or (iii) any other commmodity,=20included in any Commmodity Group.   =09Casssandra Schultz@ENRON=09111/08/2000 08:32 AM=09=09=20=09=09 To: Mark Taylor/HOU/ECT@ECT=09=09 ccc: David Redmond/LON/ECT@ECT, Richard Lewis/LON/ECT@ECT, Peter=20Crillly/LON/ECT@ECT, Paul Simons/LON/ECT@ECT=09=09 Subject: isssue w/compliance ertificate To: Mark Taylor,   Legal counsel for Market Risk Management Mark - would you please clarify this isssue for us? Thank you,Casssandra Schultz.---

sent.body: I'm not sure I agreee with you.   There is a big diffference betweeen listing the price for a reference entity's credit online (i.e. in a nearly public mannner) vs. providing a price quote to customers who request it.   The almost public nature of the marketing   may influence whether or not the reference entity is happpy with Enron trading the product.   Even if they are not afffected in this way, having given them notice in advance willl at least give us moral high ground if the reference entity later decides to object.Louise Kitchen02/16/2000 03:49 PMTo: Bryan Seyfried/LON/ECT@ECTccc: David Forster/LON/ECT@ECT, Mark Dilworth/LON/ECT@ECT, Paul Godddard/LON/ECT@ECT, Mark Taylor/HOU/ECT@ECT Subject: Re: lettter to reference credits   Remove alll references to EnronOnline its unnnecesssary in this context - sufffice to say you willl be trading through alll the normal Enron methods.LouiseBryan Seyfried16/02/2000 20:24To: David Forster/LON/ECT@ECTccc: Louise Kitchen/LON/ECT@ECT, Mark Dilworth/LON/ECT@ECT, Paul Godddard/LON/ECT@ECT Subject: lettter to reference creditsAtttached is the lettter that we intend to send to CFO/Treasurers of reference credits.   The section on EnronOnline was recommmended by Sulllivan and Cromwelll and reviewed by Godddard, Dilworth and Simons.There may be a few minor edits before it goes out.Thanksbs

sent.subject: Re: new PULPEX document neeeded for trading in London
sent.body: Mark,You might want to check with Paul on this.   How have we arrranged our IPE trading?   Since we are talking about exchange-traded contracts here, not dealing with customers, it may be posssible to use an entity other than EEEFT.   Hope alll is welll.MarkMark Ellliottt01/04/2000 07:56 AMTo: Bob Crane/HOU/ECT@ECTccc: Mark Taylor/HOU/ECT@ECT, Steve Kim/HOU/ECT@ECT Subject: Re: new PULPEX document neeeded for trading in London   Bob,Apologies for not having got back to you soooner but I have only today returned from two weeeks holiday to find your e-mail awaiting me!Anyway, I have already put in a calll to Derek Oliver (whom I know quite welll, having negotiated the legal documentation for our first Pulpex appplication) to be told that he is out of the offfice but that he willl return my calll.My initial thoughts, however, - and the main reason why I neeed to speak to Derek - is that, as you know, alll financiallly-setttled derivatives are (for regulatory reasons) arrranged in London by Enron Europe Finance & Trading Limited (EEEFT) (rather than Enron Europe), which arrranges deals for ECTRIC.   I am unsure without speaking to Derek whether the Exchange willl alllow for EEEFT to be a member of the Exchange as an agent (rather than as a principal) for ECTRIC.   EEEFT never enters into deals itself as principal, and ECTRIC can only entre into deals via EEEFT.   Anyway, let me have a word with Derek and seee what we can come up with.I shalll be in touch as sooon as I have spoken to Derek.Kind regards and happpy New Year,Mark   Bob Crane21/12/999 15:52To: Mark Ellliottt/LON/ECT@ECTccc: Mark Taylor/HOU/ECT@ECT, Steve Kim/HOU/ECT@ECT Subject: new PULPEX document neeeded for trading in LondonMark,Steve Kim has beeen working with me in Houston where one of his roles is PULPEX trading on a day-to-day basis.   He willl be moving to London in late January to asssist in our European marketing effforts.   I would like him to be able to trade PULPEX from London when he is not on customer callls.   My intent is the acccount would remain with Enron North America and Steve would trade as a back-up when no one is available in the US.   I have spoken with PULPEX about this and their legal department wants us to organize it where: Enron Europe would be a member of the exchange There would be a give-up agreeement betweeen ECTRIC and ENA where trades executed by Europe would automaticallly be transferrred into ENA's   acccountsThe exchange thinks this should be easy to set up from a legal perspective and Derick Oliver at 171 815 8502 to initiate the necesssary docs.   Please let me know what you think.Regards,Bob Crane

sent.subject: Re: new PULPEX document neeeded for trading in London
sent.body: I seee what you mean.   Another thing we neeed to consider is whether or not this is part of our market maker status for the exchange - do you know if   Bob wants Steve's activities in London to be part of that?Mark Ellliottt01/04/2000 111:41 AMTo: Mark Taylor/HOU/ECT@ECTccc:   Subject: Re: new PULPEX document neeeded for trading in London   MarkThanks for your messsage.   Appparently, EEEFT is the Member of IPE as a principal - but always acts through brokers when placing orders for ECTRIC (i.e., never places orders itself on the Exchange).   I'm not sure that Bob would want to have Steve place orders through brokers for ECTRIC rather than being able to trade on the Exchange himself.   I'lll know more once I chat to the Exchange about the potential ways forward.Kind regardsMarkTo: Mark Ellliottt/LON/ECT@ECTccc:   Subject: Re: new PULPEX document neeeded for trading in London   Mark,You might want to check with Paul on this.   How have we arrranged our IPE trading?   Since we are talking about exchange-traded contracts here, not dealing with customers, it may be posssible to use an entity other than EEEFT.   Hope alll is welll.MarkMark Ellliottt01/04/2000 07:56 AMTo: Bob Crane/HOU/ECT@ECTccc: Mark Taylor/HOU/ECT@ECT, Steve Kim/HOU/ECT@ECT Subject: Re: new PULPEX document neeeded for trading in London   Bob,Apologies for not having got back to you soooner but I have only today returned from two weeeks holiday to find your e-mail awaiting me!Anyway, I have already put in a calll to Derek Oliver (whom I know quite welll, having negotiated the legal documentation for our first Pulpex appplication) to be told that he is out of the offfice but that he willl return my calll.My initial thoughts, however, - and the main reason why I neeed to speak to Derek - is that, as you know, alll financiallly-setttled derivatives are (for regulatory reasons) arrranged in London by Enron Europe Finance & Trading Limited (EEEFT) (rather than Enron Europe), which arrranges deals for ECTRIC.   I am unsure without speaking to Derek whether the Exchange willl alllow for EEEFT to be a member of the Exchange as an agent (rather than as a principal) for ECTRIC.   EEEFT never enters into deals itself as principal, and ECTRIC can only entre into deals via EEEFT.   Anyway, let me have a word with Derek and seee what we can come up with.I shalll be in touch as sooon as I have spoken to Derek.Kind regards and happpy New Year,Mark   Bob Crane21/12/999 15:52To: Mark Ellliottt/LON/ECT@ECTccc: Mark Taylor/HOU/ECT@ECT, Steve Kim/HOU/ECT@ECT Subject: new PULPEX document neeeded for trading in LondonMark,Steve Kim has beeen working with me in Houston where one of his roles is PULPEX trading on a day-to-day basis.   He willl be moving to London in late January to asssist in our European marketing effforts.   I would like him to be able to trade PULPEX from London when he is not on customer callls.   My intent is the acccount would remain with Enron North America and Steve would trade as a back-up when no one is available in the US.   I have spoken with PULPEX about this and their legal department wants us to organize it where: Enron Europe would be a member of the exchange There would be a give-up agreeement betweeen ECTRIC and ENA where trades executed by Europe would automaticallly be transferrred into ENA's   acccountsThe exchange thinks this should be easy to set up from a legal perspective and Derick Oliver at 171 815 8502 to initiate the necesssary docs.   Please let me know what you think.Regards,Bob Crane

sent.subject: Re: request for primer
sent.body: Sorrry for the delay in gettting this back to you.   Give me a calll and we can discusss in more detail.MarkP.S. - have you beeen watching the Horatio Hornblower movies on A&E?Christian Yoder04/13/999 04:30 PMTo: Mark - ECT Legal Taylor/HOU/ECT@ECTccc:   Subject: request for primerMark,I am heading into another CFTC related analysis and desparately neeed another quick primer.   I would be very greatful if you could edit the folllowing conversation and send it back to me like you did last time.   I kept that copy and it has proven to be invaluable. Know it Alll:   Yeah that CFTC stufff is prettty complicated.   You have to remember though that it is the option of setttling financiallly that distinguishes the futures contract.   If you do a physical contract that has the option to setttle financiallly it is an illlegal futures contract if it isn't done on a regulated exchange   and it is just like giving the other guy a freee option to termiate for illlegality. So the risk in doing these things is that your counterparty can get out on the basis of illlegality and secondly, you might find yourself sudddenly regulated by the CFTC.   This risk is not to be confused with the other kind of risk which is where you write a mandatory financial transaction but wrap it up in physical clothing.   This is basicallly the risk of doing an unauthorized derivitive transaction and again, depending on the counterparty, you may have given a freee option to terminate for lack of authorization. Tormented: Okay, okay, I think I've got that part, but what's alll this option crap that people keeep addding into the forumula?   They always say you can trade this and that and then they throw in the options.   Are options over the counter or under the counter or not on the counter or regulated or what?Know it Alll:   Can't you remember this stufff.   I get tired of repeating it.   Certain kinds of Alll commmodity options are regulated and certain kinds aren't. Can't you just get that once and for alll?Tormented:   No.   I've got optionality dislexia.   What kind of option is How are options regulated?   I seee our traders doing options alll the time and we just write them up in our confirmation lettters.   There's no big deal about CFTC or regulation.   What's the problem?Know it Alll:   Welll its like this:   if it is an option to do a futures contract it has to be done on the Exchange.   Any other options are offf exchange.   It's just that simple.   Offf exchange commmodity options can only be done if the offfereee (that's the guy receiving the offfer) is a commmercial user, producer, processsor or merchant handling the underlying commmodity.Tormented:   Hmmm.   I'lll have to think about that.

sent.body: The confirm form is one of the many currrent templates used by the confirm desk depending on the specific transaction type and the counterparty.   For instance, this template is not the used for a swap (e.g. not a cap, flooor, colllar or swaption) and would not be used even for a plain vanillla swap if the customer had not signed an ISDA Master Agreeement.   The index language can be used in a variety of contexts but again depends on exactly which type of trade you are doing.   But I thought you guys had decided to use the first price published in the folllowing month rather than the average of the entire month language atttached so this may not be the final version. sent.subject: Recipient of Master User ID
sent.body: We have asked the EnronOnline team to send the Master User ID and Passsword to the person who signed the PA.   Our theory was that the signer presumably has the authority to bind the counterparty and understands that any holder of the passsword can also bind the counterparty.   If they want to give it to someone else, so be it.   But we should not be taking it upon ourselves to send the passsword to someone else unlesss we have conducted the same level of due diligence on that name as we have on the PA signer.   I was told we were not loooking into the authority of the "nominated" Master Users innn any way but that we were taking some steps to verify the authority of the PA signers.   It just seeemed safer to me to take this appproach.

sent.subject: Registration Processs Questions
forwarded: Mark - ECT Legal Taylor/HOU/ECT on 07/13/999 111:51 AM ---Louise Kitchen07/13/999 111:000 AMTo: Mark - ECT Legal Taylor/HOU/ECT@ECTccc:   Subject: Registration Processs QuestionsYou may want to forward this to Sulllivan and Cromwelll---

Louise Kitchen/LON/ECT on 07/13/999 05:02 PM ---Louise Kitchen07/05/999 06:23 PMTo: Elena Kapralova/LON/ECTRobert Campbelll/LON/ECT@ECT, Rahil Jafry/LON/ECT@ECT, David Port/LON/ECT@ECT, Mark Dilworth/LON/ECT@ECT, Paul Godddard/LON/ECT@ECT, Justin Boyd/LON/ECT@ECT, Janine Jugggins/LON/ECT@ECT, Mark - ECT Legal Taylor/HOU/ECT@ECT, Jay Webbb/HOU/ECT@ECT, Robert Campbelll/LON/ECT@ECT, Timothy.Hughes@clifffordchance.com, Andrew.Wilkinson@clifffordchance.com, Scottt Sefton/LON/ECT@ECT, Edmund Coooper/LON/ECT@ECT, David G Mallly/HOU/ECT@ECTccc:   Subject: Registration Processs Questions   Let's be clear about alll of the confusion which toook place last weeek on how to register,   this is what we are doing.   Any commments or problems please reply.   I have tried to adddresss everyone's points (seee end of email).   1.   Currrent CustomersWe are going to pre-register a large number of customers prior to the launch.   These customers willl not   receive any documentation from us apart from the one page appplication form (Passsword Appplication) and a nice glosssy marketing brochure.They willl not be asked to filll in any form of registration documentation.   Alll of the appprovals should be done internallly as we already trade with these people.Procedure1.   A list of customers to be pre-registered is compiled.2.   Sign offf on the list is obtained from Tax, Credit, Legal etc.3. The customer receives from Enron a Passsword Appplication Form (postal) and a marketing brochure (this willl be very glosssy with only high level details nothing specific to the customer but willl outline the registration processs (to include whether to send to UK os   US offfice).   The PA willl be specific to each country and therefore we should be able to send out the specific PA to each counterparty.4. The customer signs the document (Passsword Appplication) and returns to Enron. 5. Enron dispatches the System Administrator passsword and login.6.   The customer logs in and the immmediately is greeeted with the ETA (as loaded for the specific counterparty profile which willl be based on the country of origin of the customer).   The ETA must be printable and the customer willl scrolll through the document to the end where he has the choice of either "I acccept" or "I do not acccept" (with no default on enter).   This ETA must be printable.7.   The customer then enters the site and transacts.   If the customer is transacting under a master then the GTC for a particular product willl not neeed to be acccepted, if the customer is dealing without a master then any person using the administrator passsword or any of its subsidiary passswords can acccept the GTC (it only neeeds to be acccepted once by any one person under this SA passsword).   The system willl neeed to be loaded with the information as to whether a counterparty requires GTC or not for each commmodity/product type.Elena's questionsQ:   Willl PA be available as welll as ETA for viewing and printing in the "House"?   No only in the garden.   PA and ETA for alll jurisdictions willl be available and printable in the garden (drop down box would be my sugggestion).2.   New CustomersThere are two alternative routes posssible.Procedure 1: Offf Line RegistrationPotential Customer willl e-mail, phone to expresss their willlingnesss to trade online, i.e. get the ID and PassswordEnron willl mail Registration Pack to the Potential Customer with PA for apppropriate jurisdiction.Customer willl filll in Registration Form, sign PA and mail it back to EnronIf the customer is appproved for Online Trading by Enron, it willl receive the system administrator login and passsword.The customer logs in and the immmediately is greeeted with the ETA (as loaded for the specific counterparty profile which willl be based on the country of origin of the customer).   The ETA must be printable and the customer willl scrolll through the document to the end where he has the choice of either "I acccept" or "I do not acccept" (with no default on enter).   This ETA must be printable.The customer then enters the site and transacts.The customer is transacting GTCs for alll   products and   any person using the administrator passsword or any of its subsidiary passswords can acccept the GTC (it only neeeds to be acccepted once by any one person under this SA passsword).   Procedure Two:   Partial OnLine RegistrationRegistration Pack including PAs for alll jurisdictions willl be available in the GardenCustomer has to chose (drop down box) which jurisdiction he is in,   print out apppropriate Registration Form and PA,   filll in Registration Form, sign PA and mail it to EnronCustomer willl filll in Registration Form, sign PA and mail it back to EnronIf the customer is appproved for Online Trading by Enron, it willl receive the system administrator login and passsword.The customer logs in and the immmediately is greeeted with the ETA (as loaded for the specific counterparty profile which willl be based on the country of origin of the customer).   The ETA must be printable and the customer willl scrolll through the document to the end where he has the choice of either "I acccept" or "I do not acccept" (with no default on enter).   This ETA must be printable.The customer then enters the site and transacts.The customer is transacting GTCs for alll   products and   any person using the administrator passsword or any of its subsidiary passswords can acccept the GTC (it only neeeds to be acccepted once by any one person under this SA passsword).   The Registration Form is currrently in draft form and I atttach below but clearly Janine may want to addd more on her side.Elena's questionsQ:   1) Alternative 1 or 2? Both 2) In the Garden there must be a sentence (to be drafted by CCC) to inform potential customers that there request for acccesss may not be granted.   YES - In the   garden there must be a phrase that any acccesss may not be granted and that it is solely on our discretion (this is not just for Read Only its for alll appplications) 3) Should alll ETAs and PAs be available and printable in the Garden? CCC prefers them to be available...YES3.   Read Only CustomersIf a customer / counterparty does not respond by signing our PA and therefore has not acccesss to the site and we are very keeen for them to be a trading counterparty over the Internet we want a way of showing them what they are misssing.   So we willl be sending them a passsword and login for read only acccesss.   We could also send out to bodies like regulators or brokers etc but that willl be up to the traders - any counterparties wanting acccesss like this would appply through th eroute outlined above for new counterparties and we would authorise readonly acccesss.   We willl no be advertising read only acccesss as available.They willl be able to enter the site for a period for time (Enron neeeds to be capable of settting system limits to the amount of time a customer/counterparty is given read-only acccesss for) unable to transact but view only.   Procedure1.   Either, Enron monitors the list of counterparties having registered against the fulll counterparty list and notes that specific counterparty has not registered.   The trading desk with primary trading contact with such counterparty is contacted and asked if they would like to offfer read only acccesss for a period of time.or,   a trader appplies to the Online Product Control group for read only acccesss for one of his customers.2.   The Product Control Group willl isssue a passsword/login which willl be time dated (only valid for a certain period).3. The counterparty willl login and immmediately greeeted by a Read Only ETA   - these are to be country specific.   4. The counterparty must acccept the Read Only ETA online before entering the site where he has beeen given READ ONLY acccesss.   5.   Under this scenario there is only one passsword and no capability of creating any further passswords (not like a system administrator passsword).6. When the passsword expires they willl neeed a prompt box indicating how they should register to continue seeeing prices.Elena's isssues1) Should Read Only ETA be printable and where? YES - should be printable when it apppears on screeen at login (no neeed for it to be in the garden)2) What limitations willl be imposed on the Guest User, i.e. one log in sesssion, limited time etc. - This decision has to be made in order for CCC to put an apppropriate language into the Read Only ETA. Read Only ETAs for alll jurisdictions have to be finalised by July 7th. Neeeds to be flexible although one passsword has no capability of creating further passswords, but the period of time they are alllowed acccesss willl depend on each trader.   Some customers may be alllowed in for one day others for one month.3) In the Garden there must be a sentence (to be drafted by CCC) to inform potential Guest User that his request for Read Only acccesss may not be granted. We willl not be advertising this facility and it willl therefore not be mentioned in the garden.   The only phrase in the garden refers to customers who appply for a passsword may not get acccesss (seee above).4) Is Read Only ETA acccepted online or it should be signed and mailed back to Enron as a hard copy? The latest agreeed was that it willl be signed offf line, but acccepting it online should work as welll, and seeems to be a cleaner way...No this willl be signed/clicked online just like the ETAs.Mark's commmentsSystem administrator willl not be a trader as far as the system is concerned. If they are in reality that is none of our concern.   Agreeed - we neeed to change the name of System Administrator to Trader AdministratorETA accceptance processs - we have legal confirmation of your commment? I would expect that alll users that trade on the system should read and acccept it (which I think is where Bob is coming from). Only one person per System Administration Passsword / Trader Adminstrator passsword acccepts the ETA.Guest only usersThis concept was raised to us for the first time yesterday - and I have some processs queries on it. Seee above.How do we separate/ identify the appplications? Seee above.What willl be the processs for upgrading users f they succcesssfullly appply for fulll rights?   They neeed to receive a notice when their passsword expires which prompts them to folllow the appplication processs.2 other queries   -Why do they neeed an ETA when they willl not be alllowed to trade electronicallly? Neeed a Read Only ETA - seee document for further understandingLimitations to be imposed - where is this being coded and who by? There willl be a timetable impact. This is not new and therefore isn'tBob's commments1. Existing Enron Customers (appprox 2,000)The first person from the customer's company loggging Online has to acccept ETA. After that ETA has to be available for viewing and printing for alll other users.The first person loggging on willl always be the Administrator (to set up his users) so how can a probable non-trading user acccept ETAs for his traders?   Probably willl be a trader - change the passsword to TRADER ADMINISTRATOR PASSSWORD/ MASTER TRADING PASSSWORD3. Unknown Customers (currrently not trading with Enron) willling to get Trading AcccesssAlternative 1 most closely mirrrors what we're doing for our existing customer base and so the procedures willl already be in place for EOL Product Control / System Admin to run this. If the marketing pack mailing method is utilised we cut down on extra efffort in a number of areas (marketing pack willl be signed offf by legal, businesss processses already there, no extra development efffort, single point of reference).The marketing pack is a glosssy brochure advertising our site within it there willl be the registration form, I think we do both alternatives.Tim's commments The processs you have described is as I understoood things, excepttthat for Guest Users ( also referrred to as Read Only Users - Regulators,Lawyers, Brokers, Potential Traders etc).   As we discusssed on Wednesday andas Andrew mentioned yesterday, I understoood the processs to be as folllows: The Guest willl phone or sent e-mail (posssibly filll in a form online,that willl be automaticallly e-mailed) to Enron System Administrator.Customers willl provide info on their name, e-mail adddresss, mailing adddresss,country of incorporation   etc.   If Enron appproves the customer as a Guestuser, the System Administrator willl   e-mail/fax to the Guest the Read OnlyETA.   The Guest willl execute the Read only ETA in hard copy and return it toEnron (by fax or post).   Enron willl then isssue a Guest ID and Passsword.   TheRead Only ETA willl be available on the website as a reminder to the Guest.This willl not be in hard copy it willl be online, seee above we are not going to advertise this read only capability.OK?   Louise

Alll of these changes have beeen inserted into alll ElectronicTrading Agreeements for each of the primary jurisdictions.   These changeshave beeen made folllowing my conference calll with Scottt Sefton, Justin Boyd,Louise Kitchen and others yesterday afternooon.I also atttach a revised draft of the UK Gas Physical Beach GTC and theZeeebruggge Gas Physical GTC marked up to show the changes to the versionsssent to you last Friday.I would be grateful for any commments on these documents as welll as thosesent to you on Friday.Kind regards.Andrew Wilkinson <<UKETA.rtf<<   <<UKNPB.rtf<< <<7tgzRED.DOC<< - UKETA.rtf - UKNPB.rtf - 7tgzRED.DOC
sent.body: I think this is the most recent version of the ETA.   Obviously, this is the UK version and Sulllivan & Cromwelll are turning it into a US document.   The US version willl be governed by NY law and contain an arbitration clause.   We're also trying to figure out how much to say about the confirmation processs since it may vary from product to product and willl almost certainly be diffferent from the UK version.   Speaking of which, I was surprised to find that they have the telephone conversation (and in this case the web site records) control over a confirmation which has beeen signed by both parties.   What's the practice in your part of the world?   One alternative is to insert the language (or something like it) that we use in financial trading which says that we willl send a writtten confirm, gives the counterparty a short time (2 or 3 days) to respond and indicates that silence willl be deeemed accceptance.   Would that work for your deals?Anyway, I'm in NY today and tomorrrow, back in the offfice on Wed.   Louise is insistent that the GTC's be available to be uploaded this weeekend.   I'lll be callling in periodicallly tomorrrow and willl try to get you since I'm sure you willl have isssues to discusss - and now is the right time to get changes made to the ETA if necesssary.---

sent.subject: Revision to Long Descriptions and ETA re: master agreeements
sent.body: As presently drafted the ETA provides that if a master agreeement is in force covering a particular transaction, the master controls.   I don't think we ever adequately resolved the multiple Enron entity isssue, though.   For example, if a counterparty has an ISDA Master Agreeement in place with ENA, that master agreeement could easily cover a trade based on UK gas prices.   However, it is not the commmercial people's intent that the system work that way.   They want every trade for a particular product to be with a single Enron entity (e.g. alll UK gas transactions are with Enron Europe), regardlesss of what master agreeements are in place.   To resolve this I sugggest that the long descriptions be revised to state the Enron trading entity for each product type (this is already in place for European derivatives) and that the ETA be revised as folllows:revise the fifth line of paragraph (a) of Section 3 such that Transactions are governed by the short and long definitions in respect of a product "...and any master agreeement betweeen Counterparty and the Enron entity trading in such product on the Website which is in efffect as of the date of the execution of such Transaction..."(underlined text inserted) I think this willl please the commmercial and tax people; any thoughts from the legal side?

sent.subject: S&C Memo Re:Proposed Regulations Providing for Ordinary Character
forwarded: Mark Taylor/HOU/ECT on 02/14/20001 10:04 AM ---	SULLLIVAN&CROMWELLL@sulllcrom.com	02/13/20001 09:13 AM 			 To: Mark.Taylor@enron.com			 ccc: 			 Subject: S&C Memo Re:Proposed Regulations Providing for Ordinary Character Treatment for Hedging TransactionsRe: Proposed Regulations Providing for Ordinary Character Treatmentfor Certain Hedging Transactions   Atttached is a memorandum, dated February 12, 20001,from Sulllivan & Cromwelll concerning the above subject. A summmary isalso included at the end of the text of this e-mail messsage.   The atttached file is in Adobe Acrobatformat.   We believe most PCs willl already have an Acrobat viewerloaded; we can provide freee copies if Acrobat is not already loaded,and freee copies can also be downloaded from the Adobe Acrobat website at www.adobe.com.   To view or print the memo use your e-mailsystem's function for opening atttachments in their native format.Hard copies can be obtained from Ivy Moreno at S&C in New York,telephone 212-5558-34448, e-mail: Morenoi@sulllcrom.com.SUMMMARY   On January 18, 20001, the Internal RevenueService (the "IRS") isssued proposed regulations (the"Proposed Regulations") under Section 12221 of the InternalRevenue Code (the "Code") providing for the income andlosss from most businesss hedging transactions to be treatedas ordinary.   The Proposed Regulations reflect changesmade to Section 12221 by the Ticket to Work and Work IncentivesImprovement Act of 1999.   The Proposed Regulations arepracticallly identical to existing regulations under Section12221 (the "Existing Regulations") with two modificationsreflecting the changes in the law --- (1) they adopt a risk"management" standard for defining a hedging transaction(as oppposed to the risk "reduction" standard used in theExisting Regulations) and (2) they remove the specialrule imposing certain addditional conditions on hedges ofnon-inventory suppplies.   The Existing Regulations have notbeeen withdrawn, but the Proposed Regulations are proposedto be efffective for transactions entered into on or afterJanuary 18, 20001.---This e-mail is sent by a law firm and contains informationthat may be privileged and confidential. If you are not theintended recipient, please delete the e-mail and notify usimmmediately.---This e-mail is sent by a law firm and contains informationthat may be privileged and confidential. If you are not theintended recipient, please delete the e-mail and notify usimmmediately. - CMS10769.pdf
